column1: review

Third time is the straw. My order was missing the main topping. Salami of all things! You would think I would learn. Unfortunately I order through the app and this is the store I am required to use. The manager was not interested at ALL in fixing the problem! It didn't show on their end so not their problem! Screw customer service! I say screw them. Cold day in hell, before I order from them again!

It use to be good food I always order there. two large cheese pizza and the whole thing was burnt I didn't even call them because they don't care. This is the second time I won't be coming here anymore going to Antonio's pizza

Please don't go and waste your money. They should be ashamed of themselves. It's bad enough the food is overpriced but it's horrible to boot. Everything was served cold and over salted. The lobster mac and cheese was dry, their lobster tails were huge oysters from the gulf - poor quality ingredients with no taste. Go somewhere else. This place is like a dying horse. Someone needs to put it down. Restaurant smelled like an old Vegas carpet to boot. Dirty. SMH IF I COULD GIVE ZERO STARS I WOULD. $800 wasted.

I came in around 2:30pm on a Saturday and ordered the shrimp po-boy and their chargrilled oysters. The bread was stale and shrimp lacked flavor. Oysters were not great, pretty disappointing considering that's their thing. Service was very slow and the prices charged were not what was on their menu. Wouldn't recommend.

Service has gone to the bottom. This particular Chik-fil-a needs to on "Restaurants on Edge". I can't understand why the line is all the way in the street just to turn around and have the wrong order given to me. The last straw, for me, was not having yogurt parfaits at 8:30 in the morning. You know how your mom says if you don't have anything nice to say, don't say it?...sorry mom! Get it together! Some people actually depend on breakfast to carry them through lunch. How do you not have yogurt parfaits at 8:30? "We were short staffed this morning." All I could see was money being lost...where's the District Manager!!!! Help! How about bacon on my sandwich. I don't eat pork...wth? There is so much more to say...this is just MY beginning.

Come eat here if you like underpaid and overworked staff with mediocre food. Foods edible and over priced; just go to Ruth Chris and get a filet or pay $40 for steak fajitas your call . Staff is miserable including the General manager. I highly suggest crab claws for your meat...welll here we are over a year later no such thing as claws just tails oh yea and after tax $4 a soda. Enjoy the friendly atmosphere. Oh yea and dont forget that service charge on to go orders; it goes to the owner and the managers get the tips for bagging it wow yet they expect the servers to take phone orders what a joke. My friend ate ceviche and literally started to turn blue and the ambulance had to take her away when the french market location was open. That says enough

THEY ALWAYS GET THE ORDER WRONG!! At this point I am convinced they eat the food while cooking it. My dad ordered 15 wings and they came back with 13 wings. He also asked for large fries that he paid for and they gave him a small. Another time I ordered a cheesecake pie and it wasn't included at all in the order. This happens everytime we come to this BWW! We decided not to come back here ever again. I wouldn't recommend.
Pad Thai is more like pad pudding. Noodles overcooked. Eating Thai used to be good. Now they don't care. Overpriced substandard food.

It doesn't get worse than this. A $28.00 charcuterie platter that consisted of less than one ounce each if meat and cheese and just covered in al disgusting manner with stale bread and crackers. Horrible NYE celebration and the manager was obtuse. No decent cheg would have allowed that plate to leave his kitchen. We live less than a mile away and will NEVER RETURN. We encourage all Yelp users to avoid this place. If you can't get a charcuterie platter right, how bad must everything that needs to be cooked be.

Ordered on Uber eats and only got part of my order. Called to say they forgot a half pound of burnt ends I was told no they combined them together. No we weighed them and it was only 8 ounces. Coleslaw had no flavor or seasoning. I was not impressed.

Went just recently on Sunday. Over rated and over priced. Had prime rib and shrimp cocktail but prime rib extremely cold and shrimp overly cooked mushy. Cannot Believe I paid all that money to get the most delicious out of all the food the Pho - hot and tasty broth even with the Ok wontons. Grand Buffet is no longer "Grand". Things have changed with the times. I understand due to times the price increase but quality should still be there but no longer the case.
Got it on Uber eats. Forgot our drinks, food was totally bland, both the lasagne and the chicken parmigiana. Was cold , pasta was watery and the side salad was a joke.$60 + waste of money .

Don't order delivery. Third time in a row they have got my order wrong. I'm not sure what is going on over there. Recently I ordered 3 different orders of wings and a burger & they sent me one order of wings in the wrong flavor & a burger with just meat and a bun.
I just paid $22 for this "green curry with chicken" didn't come with rice nor the vegetables described in the ad.

So. I Googled best Mexican restaurants in Tucson and El Chinito Gordo came up. We looked at the menu online and thought we'd try it. Big mistake. The menu looks good and the young lady who served us was very sweet, but the food was awful. My husband had menudo and it was cold and not made with red chile sauce. The tripe was fatty, chewy and the hominy was straight out of the can uncooked. I had a chile relleno, which, was actually pretty good. However, I ordered beans and got rice. I had a Birria Gordita with it, and it was bland with very little meat. I ordered a house margarita, which was terrible. The chips and salsa were ok, we've had better. I feel bad, but this place was not good. Don't waste your money.

This bar is my usual spot with my friends but last night things took a turn for the worst. The DJ randomly said over the speaker "there's way too many black people here!" This stupid little bar is clearly racist and I'm disgusted. I will not be going back to that shit hole.

Super disappointed I just ordered via Uber eats. It doesn't look like they added spirulina which I paid extra for and I asked for granola on the side and didn't get it which is basically my favorite part. Phone number on the receipt is invalid so can't even call to let them know.

Absolutely horrible service!!!! Not rating anything you can kiss my ass! This is just to INFORM the people that this is the worst place to go too!!! please don't go here and waste your time and money. You would have to wait for an HOUR for the food. I noticed that the Dave and busters in New Orleans has a bunch of black people and I love people of all colors! But Dave and busters has the WORST STAFF/EMPLOYEES EVER

I really wish I could give 0 stars. Whoever the hell Tyler is, you're a horrible shitty manager... To let me explain.. we made an order at this specific sonic location on 1/13/2022 The order contained exactly 25.09 dollars of food we ordered. (For whatever reason sonic thinks they can get away with selling shitty food for that price but my girlfriend loves it so here we are) My girlfriend asked for a #1 combo, Simple cheeseburger. No lettuce, pickle tomato, onion, We received a sandwich that wasn't even the sandwich we ordered. It was very small in size. And contained no sauce and only onion. No biggie so we called the store. Friendly little chap Tyler answered. This is about how the call went Tyler: hello this is (shitty food place) Me: hi can I please speak to the manager? Tyler: speaking Me: explains the burger problem. And not getting what I paid for cause 25$ is a lot to spend on food that isn't what you asked Tyler: it looks like you didn't ask for no onion Me: but we did? Absolute silence.... Not a single word from this guys horrible monotone voice. Tyler: is there anything else I can do for you? I just decided to hang up. Lesson learned. Fuck sonic and fuck Tyler :)
This establishment is violently racist. If you're African American or a person of color please spend your money somewhere else. This is not the place to be!!!

Don't book a room here!! Could not cancel a reservation because my flight was delayed in the air due to high wind and I could not use my phone because I was in the air till after midnight on the day of the reservation. The manager would not refund and was extremely rude and hung up on me because I said "this is the way you treat your customers" she referred to this as "verbal abuse"

This is our third time eating here. First time was really good. Had a crunchy chili relleno. Second time had the same again and it was eh ok. Last night we went and tried something different. I had the chicken fundido burrito. I asked the very nice waiter to add onions. The wife had a fajita burrito. My fundido chicken burrito had barely any flavor to it. Full of chicken with a few onions smothered in cheese and a white cheese sauce. Again with all that there was no flavor. Wife's fajita burrito was full of meat and veg but had a sweet taste to it Nothing like fajitas should taste. The waiter was a very nice young man who was very attentive. I'm doubting we will go back there again, which is sad because there aren't any good restaurants way out on this side of town.

Tiffany Nathan is a skanky server here that will give her phone number to any hot guys that come in She's thirsty for cock. Tiffany Nathan loves giving her number out 813-402-6683. Call for a good time and you'll get some world famous buffalo wings to eat with the skank wad too! 813-402-6683. She loves all cock.

First time at Ruth's Chris, VERY DISAPPOINTED!! Portions were very small, it was expensive, the service was slow, and the food was not as GREAT as advertised!!! Come ON!! I know things tough right now.

We walked in at 7:20, hours posted said till 8pm. They decided they were gunna close early, which is totally fine, BUT they didn't tell us when we got there. They waited till we sat down and started eating before the manager said that we needed to get out. They should've told us the minute we walked in, "Hey we are closing early, all orders are to go only." But they didn't and when my husband said, "why didn't you tell us when we got in here." The manager got really aggressive and raised his voice and said rudely, "do you want to stay here another HOUR." All in front of my 6 month old. All we wanted to do was finish our sandwiches. Won't be coming here again and don't recommend it. Blaze is right down the road and much better!
Not good. Service was OK but the food abysmal. The best thing was the salad. Fried rice had no taste. The filet was basic. Veggies a no go. Just not good overall. Buyer beware. Pretty bad.

i waited about an hour for a table when i was told the wait was 20 minutes sat down my appatizer came out with my food my shrimp was completely raw as well as my dads fish the lighting was so dim he had ate about half of his fish and when he told the waiter she said oh it's fine and laughed it off he was brought a new plate they took my whole plate which included shrimp steak mashed patatos and broccoli to the back not once but twice and then brought out the same plate they remade my shrimp it came out raw again for the second time and when i asked to speak to the manger she said she would comp my meal threw away my food and didn't ask if she could remake it when i asked her to remake my food my waiter had brought it out and said here's your lunch for tommrow and rolled her eyes mind you i was in this restaurant for about two hours and all i had so far was bread and a bite of raw shrimp

If I could give a 0 I would. Don't go for lunch. It will make you sick. I've read other reviews that have said the staff doesn't pay workers fairly and I will not support a business who doesn't take care of their staff.
Bait and switch. Beware. Ordered a lunch from online menu. When I picked it up prices were higher by 20%. No recourse. Unethical.

Bad customer service we walked up to the register and the lady was on her phone didn't greet us we waited for her to get off her phone to help us then as I was ordering a steak the lady was very rude and talking about other customers ordering, the place is very dirty not a pleasant visit

This place is DISGUSTING. Not only have they been shut down for bad health conditions and accused of treating their employees like trash and not cleaning anything. They decided to put up politics on their sign which is not good business. Very disgusting and gross. This place needs to be shut down for good.

Expensive, poor service, and food not great. Our bill was over $100 for 4 people. 1 Beer and no other drinks. Only 1 chip basket per table, but we had a large party and would only give 4 baskets. Our server never filled our drinks and was charged a mandatory gratuity.

I ordered a delivery order. I received my order confirmation via email. I began tracking my order and for 40 minutes my order stayed on prep. Over an hour later I received a call saying they were canceling my order because the driver left at 8 and I put my order in after 8. I will never order from this dominos again.
Chicken was gross had no flavor. Rice tasted old and cold spent 50.00 what a wast of money this place is horrible

Pizza and calzone just isn't very good. Whatever you do, don't go there to pick it up! I've lived in plenty of truly dangerous places in my lifetime, but I can't think any situation in which I was more certain of impending robbery, carjacking, or getting shot than waiting in that parking lot for our order to get done! Seriously!

I have been a loyal customer of starbucks for a few years, and over the past year alone I visited starbucks at least 4x every week. I have always been satisfied with my order and the amount of time it took to prepare, however, I am extremely disappointed with their service in the course of the past few months. The store hours have been decimated so much that it is almost impossible to get in there once a week. I have made many phone calls asking for the new store hours but i get different answer every time. The website has not been updated and myself as well as a few others have tried to be flexible and come by when we can, but it is almost always closed. I'm not sure if this is due to short staffing or covid, but you are losing customers and money. Please take into consideration everything i have said. Thank you.

Ordered three items. One showed up when driver came the first time. They offered me a 2L soda. Don't drink soda. The quality of food was not there. Horrible pizza, horrible wings, but mostly just non-existent customer service. $30. We are two wings out of each order and two slices. Had to throw everything away.

We ordered take out and were told it would be 30 min. We sat and waited for an additional 30 minutes because it wasn't ready. The food is good but not worth the inconvenience and wait. Will not be returning.
Horrible leadership for a small business. The management is very unprofessional. This business will never succeed with management who power trip. Team work would be more successful!!!

This is the worst time I've had here. We had an 8PM reservation for 15 but was not seated until 8:30 PM. After being seated for 30 min, our drink orders were finally taken. 30 min after that appetizer orders were taken. 45 min after that entree orders were taken. We asked several times for the manager and he never came. Finally the guest of honor went to the bar where the manager was located but he was brash with her. After asking again for the manger at the table because the entree orders took an hour and a half to come out. When the manager came to the table he was brash yet again. No apology was ever offered. To his credit, Langston was doing as best he could to serve the table but he was only one person with little to no help. Every with the understanding of the impact of Covid, preparations should have been taken for a pasty of this size with advance reservations. Additionally, a simple apology from the manager instead of an unprofessional response would have gone a long way.
Pretty sure I got food poisoning from expired cabbage in the chow mein 2 days ago. Should have trusted my nose.

VERY racist & rude. If you're African American, do yourself a favor and go to other nearby Latino eateries. They treat other Latino and white people fine, but they appear to not welcome black people here. Marelin P is such a rude and racist cashier!!!

I was looking forward to having a nice birthday dinner by treating myself to someplace better than average. I was seated right away (thanks to self seating). Someone brought water right away. The waiter took my order and brought me a drink. 45 minutes later I walked out. Having only had one soda. I ordered the Shrimp Cocktail appetizer to be followed by the Surf and Turf entree, I even upgraded to the Caesar Salad. I was going to top it of with the Crem Brulee. No food ever came to my table. No waiter approached my table again. Not even an offer to refill my drink. I was planning on leaving a decent tip on top of an expensive meal. Instead I left hungry. Worst dining experience I have ever had, not just in Reno. Do yourself a favor, go to Outback.

We stayed at the hotel next door and was looking for a late night pizza place and decided to give this place a try. We had a 10 inch pizza and an order of breadsticks. The breadsticks was ok but the pizza was not very tasteful. The workers at this place were not to welcoming either and seemed like they did not want to be there. Would not recommend to anyone.
They get my order wrong 90% of the time and they always seem grouchy and irritated that your making them work

They gave me a 55 minute time to be ready.im fine with that. Showed up 25-30 minutes later Charged me 20% of what I ordered for a service delivery fee. I tipped as well. Got Raw uncooked pizza not the right sauces and where is the cheese on any of that. Avoid at all cost. Just now got into my raw chicken and burnt dessert. Delivery was service was fine but I would've waited another 20 minutes for the quality of food I paid for and expected.

I admit that I am typically too lazy to write reviews but I had such a poor experience today that I feel an obligation to warn others. I was in the city with my daughter today, had heard this place had just opened and thought it would be a fun late and light lunch and dessert. With all patience and acknowledgment of the difficulties right now - this was still a disaster. Service was slow and inattentive. Food was not great. I had to track down our server to find our missing food. I had to remind her to clear dishes so there was sufficient room to eat our desserts. The bathroom had no toilet paper or soap. Spare yourselves and wait until this place gets its act together.

20 minutes never got an order, asked for money back which took another 15 minutes. If you are hungry and actually want food to eat.... go elsewhere. The one in Carson is 30x better and you drive thru it in 5 minutes tops. Also, it smells like a clogged toilet in there.

Their food is okay, but their service is so awful, slow and rude that you will never want to go back. I live nearby and have given them at least 5 chances, just not worth it, there are tons of other lovely places Old City has to offer with wonderful ownership!

Wow. That was a bad chicken meal. I was the only person in the store and ordered an 8 pc dark plus fries, biscuits and mashed potatoes with gravy. After I paid I went to pick up my food. The chicken bag seemed light - after checking there was only 6 pcs. I told the worker and she gave me 2 more. I got home and discovered we received Mac n cheese instead of mashed potatoes. I hate this kind of carelessness. The fries were a soggy waste of money. I received 12 biscuits instead of 8. Thanks but no thanks. I'll go to Popeyes next time we want to splurge calories on fried chicken.

Fucking disgusting I got a bean and cheese chimi and side of rice to go never again if you can't get the beans right the rest is shit stars 0.5because the $1.75can soda was good and that didn't really come from them

Came in with my wife yesterday excited to check it out. We were seated immediately by the young lady hostess. As there were only one other couple in the place we figured there would be next to no wait. We were wrong. One of the owners stood 10 feet away from us talking to a couple that had finished their meal. Apparently they knew each other or their families knew each other and they enjoyed their conversations. We were completely ignored for 10 minutes. This was extremely disappointing not only because we were hungry we were truly interested in having a new pizza place to frequent. To run a business successfully as an owner you need to be responsive to your customers! Ignoring people when no one else is in your restaurant will not produce positive results and unfortunately, we will not return.

I hate to give a one star review, but this Wendy's location has been pure frustration to deal with; it is open completely random hours! Until last week I've had pretty good luck with weekday lunch. I arrived at 1:00 PM to find a crane hovering over the restaurant replacing an air conditioner. And of course they were closed. Conveniently there is a McDonalds two parking lots away, so I don't go hungry, but IMO Wendy's has far fresher tasting food. And before someone comes up with a pandemic / supply chain / hiring comment, the McDonalds 500 feet away is open their posted hours every day, no excuses. C'mon Wendy's, get your act together!
Closed for construction and didn't notify Yelp or google - bad business - just walked 15 minutes to get here

The customer service is AWFUL! I leave in just as bad a mood as the employees. I love Cava but I think I'm gonna have to be done with this one. This time the associates were vocal they were ready to close. I got to the point where they add meat and they had ONE. They were not cooking anymore and judging by the fact the grill was cleaned way before I got there they didn't care. We weren't given an option for drinks and the card readers were broken. While eating we were all locked in with no one attending the door which is surely a fire hazard. We had to figure out how to unlock the door to get out. Maybe the Franklin location will be better.

New Year's Day and weather was lousy and, as we were staying at the Dream Hotel, we availed ourselves of the on-site restaurant. Waitress was efficient and recommended the chef's special, prime rib, and served medium rare, as chef recommended. First attempt was well done, so I sent it back; second attempt was rarer but stone cold. When I pointed this out, the manager appeared and proceeded to school me on how prime rib is to be served cold. I know quite well how to cook beef medium rare and how to keep it warm and the manager's condescending manner did nothing to make the meat tasty. The side dishes were hot and delicious. My husband's prawn meal was good.
We love the food but was so so disappointed last night! We chose it for dinner and they missed up our order, it was Uber delivery so it was hard to fix as it's the restaurant mistake.

Stopped in for breakfast as the outside patio was completely empty. Was told it would take a little bit to find a server to work out there and take care of us. Waited for a while and then was told it would be "probably 20 more minutes or longer" before someone could serve us outside (another party was already seated outside too and had service). Really dumb.

I came here for the comedy...and to vent a bit. If I could sit down with the owner for at least 5 mins and just hear the reason for the foolishness so it could all make sense. Honestly, I think I'm more interested with the magic of keeping a place open that makes little to no money when the employees clearly make more than what's on their paycheck. Straight

Total rip off- ordered M&M cookies and they called to say they were out of those so we wanted to cancel the order- but they told us they would add M&Ms to the sugar cookies. Long story short we pick up the cookies and NO M&Ms in the cookies. I called them and the person who answered (same person that called to tell us they were out the cookies) and said "whoops, we were actually out of M&Ms. I should've called you back." But of course they didn't because they didn't want to lose the sale. Well you've lost a customer. Grow up and run your business like a professional.

Sat at the bar and our server was extremely flirtatious with my fiancé. I'd understand if we went to hooters or another restaurant where you go for the girls, but we did not go for the girls. she got my drink order wrong 3 times, forgot my side when our food came out, and brought him silverware but not me. super attentive to my fiancé. and he wasn't even the one that paid!!! the bar was also littered with drinks from previous guests and had definitely not been wiped down.

The food used to be good.We've tried to give it few more tries, hoping it'll be at least decent tasting. This last visit was definitely the reason we won't be back. When we're seated, no one said anything. No welcome, here's the menu, waters? Nothing. 10 min later, a girl brought chips and salsa and said nothing and walked away. Another 10 min, our waiter comes up with menus, sets them down doesn't say a name and just says drinks. We didn't get a drink menu and had literally just received the regular menus. Which have changed every time we've been here. We ordered and got our food really fast. Not even 20 min. But the food orders were wrong and cold. We paid our bill and left.

Waited forever, Never got our food. The manager kindly said "I'll take it off the bill" Well thanks since we never got it...sub par service. The couple next to us nearly walked out for same reason. Trust me, skip this place. Terrible experience all around

I ordered a half cheese half pepperoni pizza. When i got my pizza, i bit into it to realize that under the cheese on the only cheese side there was pepperoni. I do not eat meat so this was a big deal. Seemed like someone didn't realize it was half cheese and tried to cover the mistake with cheese. When we called, the manager immediately told us we ordered all pepperoni with extra cheese. I have proof this was wrong. He argued with us when i asked if it was all pepperoni why was half covered with cheese? Seems there's something wrong almost every time i order here as this is not a first.

Over priced Mexican food and they make sure to purposely make your food incorrect to steal from you. My husband ordered me the pambazo with steak meat and there was no steak meat! Slow service and not a friendly place to give your business to. If you do decide to try this place make sure to unwrapped your food and make sure your food is made correctly, but if you have to go through all that trouble, then my best suggestions is to avoid this place at all cost. I would NOT RECOMMEND! there's better Mexican restaurant out here in Reno.

Walked in and immediately a younger lady with glasses approached vigorously. We walked over to her and simply asked her about the packages and she had an attitude the whole time. At that point, We decided to leave. Very rude customer service. Find workers that will actually treat customers well. Do better. Dog shit

i'm actually so disappointed speaking of the fact wawa never lets me down. they didn't have chicken for my quesadilla or roasted veggies and they made me pay before they wanted to tell me they had nothing i wanted and wouldn't give me a refund. get it together.

I was given an offer for a free medium 2 topping pizza from dominos but they would not let me order it because it didn't reach the "minimum delivery price of $17". So it's essentially an empty offer. Why even tell people that then? What the point? Just reeks of laziness.
He ordered his steak medium well and it came out bloody and smelled sour.. but I loved the passive aggressive response so thank you

I ordered out and was missing half my order including the 2 sauces. And the French fries were awful. They were hard and cold. After it taking them 2 hours to even get it done. As they were trying to resolve it i was on hold for 45 mins waiting for a manger, so I hung up called back because they completely forgot I was on hold. So all in all not a great experience.

We have tried this restaurant three times and really wanted to like it as we live close by in Bryn Mawr. The food is average at best and the interior decor is as budget as it gets. The service at the table has always been friendly, but slow which I would actually enjoy if it were a good Italian restaurant. However, the biggest turnoff is the extremely rude (all three times now) hostess that makes you feel you need to leave immediately after eating even when the restaurant is 80% empty. I love that this location is a restaurant over the old Wells Fargo bank, but I hate to say I hope this place closes and another establishment of better quality takes its place.
Garbage service, they received my order but did not follow through with making and delivering it after they confirmed the order.
God this place was disgusting. The soup tasted like straight up dish soap and ruined my appetite and made me sick. Don't go here.

Went here 1 hr before my flight thinking I had plenty of time. I was seated at a table and waited 20 minutes with no one coming to take my order. A family came and sat 3 tables down and got their order taken within 5 minutes and then the server walked the opposite direction from me. I went to the bar to approach the server and asked why they didn't take my order. They said my table was not assigned a server. She said she would get my order shortly. About a minute later the same host who sat me, Bryan, came and asked if I just walked in and sat myself. I responded you sat me here twenty minutes ago! About a minute later a nice server, Erika, came and took the order and got it done. I wonder how long I would have had to sit there with no response from someone because the host, Bryan, doesn't know how to do the most important part of his job...seat people. Erika, our server finally, was great. Bryan not so much.

Just like Hamilton stated below...they're still on that mask mandate mess but I wouldn't even have been upset if the staff wasn't so freakin rude about it! On top of that they didn't even have any mask to offer customers smh Literally embarrassing unprofessional and rude! Never again! ....and shoutout to Hip City Veg next door!they'll see me again.

Very disappointed went there over there over the weekend and order pho ga when they handed me my bowl I found A bug in my bowl, told the guy I want A net one ending up the new bowl wasn't good at all very disappointed
Had to wait 45 minutes for a cappuccino. The staff were sweet but to wait that long for coffee is ridiculous

went through, line was slow as usual but nothing crazy. our total was $10 we got a mac & cheese and a chicken sandwich. we paid and the person that took our money closed the window and left to get our food. then this girl begrudgingly open the window and told us we owed $31. i said "no we actually just paid you're mistaken" and she closed the window. we finally got our food, i open my LARGE mac n cheese, and it was filled, i kid you not, just above the cups half way point. i was genuinely shocked when i saw that, because to me, you wouldn't fill a large that low unless it was on purpose.. and if these employees are taking out their frustrations on the customers then this place is not going to last. i'll definitely never visit this location again. you just lost a customer popeyes. picture attached to review is right after i opened the lid. half empty. rude as hell. i'm pissed.

The 5 times I have been there.... I have never seen everything available. Something is always out. One time they had no chicken. Another time no peppers. This time 2 sodas in the machine were out. The silverware was out. And every employee was chatting in back and no one was up front. No hustle or lack of care. Line is to the door. They need more staff and more product.

I went to get a vanilla cream cold brew and asked for the 20 ounce and was basically told I wasn't allowed to get it. It was under cold brew and the lady was rude to me and said "it's a specialty drink and only comes in one size". I pointed to where it was on the menu in the store where it is listed to come in 2 different sizes and she still refused to give me what is displayed in their store. The ounces are not an issue for me it was just the way it was handled and how it is displayed. It should be covered so that it is not confusing for the customers. I also looked in the app to see if maybe the location just had the wrong information and you are able to pick either size. Not sure what the issue is but it needed to be addressed.

The female bartender on nye underestimated us, she made my friends feel like we were below it and that we weren't worth her time. Literal conversation "what dressings do you have" "they're house made you wouldn't know how they taste" OKAY THEN DESCRIBE THEM YA FREAK she was quite literally the worst don't go there unless you feel like getting degraded
Slow service, clueless managers, greasy food, dirty plates and not to mention the place itself is dirty. Sad attempt at an upscale restaurant

What happened to this place ????? Pizza use to be good when I first moved to Florida from up north ... came back and I would rather go buy little ceasers for $5 instead .. nasty pizza even the coke from the soda machine rates like trash .. place looks dirty as well !! YOUVE VEEN WARNED

We were looking for top rated Italian restaurants in the area and Alfano's was at the top. I was hoping for a good hole in the wall place, but this wasn't it.

My partner and I love a good breakfast place- unfortunately, the roost did not quite meet our standards. We came on a Saturday morning. Restaurant wasn't busy and staffed well. When we got seated we had to wait 10 mins for a server to come and take our drink order. Then, after our drinks, they didn't stop by for another 10 mins until we made that awkward, across the restaurant, eye contact letting them know we need something. My coffee tasted burnt and they didn't have any flavored creamers (how!). My partner ordered an iced tea that was 90% water and 10% tea. It was just a mess. As for the food: very average and very "eh." Our bacon was alittle over cooked, my over easy egg was almost completely cooked through... the only decent item was our French toast, but even that was very average. Long story short, we most likely wont go back. There's a lot of little things with easy fixes that can be made to make this place better.

This was the worst Kung Pao I've ever had. Only a couple pieces of super dry over cooked chicken with 1000 green onions (even the bottoms) and bamboo shoots with absolutely zero spice. How this is Kung Pao is beyond me.... Also ordered sweet and sour chicken which was fine but it comes with sauce already on it. My son wouldn't touch it. Wish it said this on the menu.

I'm embarrassed to say I ate here in New Orleans. It was on our last day before a long car ride home, and this was the simplest option. We thought it would be faster than it was, so we could have gone somewhere better in the same amount of time.
UPDATE- Same great taste but awful portions. The order that you see here came to a sum of $70 and the forgot to include my mango lassi. Raised their prices and reduced their portions.

Sad to leave this review, however have been giving the restaurant a number of visits with increasingly disappointing results. We also have left a few messages for Dario, who never calls 1. Today we ordered a vegetable fasilli and the chicken brick dish. Neither was very good. The pasta dish lacked flavor. There wasn't much in terms of vegetables. It was so disappointing I thought of taking a picture but it really was such a boring dish. White beans would give this some flavor and more protein. We've suggested they look at adding some beans to their vegan vegetarian dishes but have been met with radio silence 2 The chicken brick dish was not very good. Three people tried it and all were very disappointed. I'll try to add a picture of it. Very little of it was eaten. 3. The bread is an Average plus We used to go here years ago and it was pretty good. I Food today was from the Santa Barbara location on Victoria Street. We've also had disappointing meals At their montecito location. We really wish they would spend a little bit more time on their items and their ingredients especially for the pricing. Especially given they do not have good vegan options and haven't bothered to get back to us, we think we are done trying. Ciao Ca Dario

The spring rolls were good, the pork baboons were good but that one piece of mini cucumber did not give the crunch factor. The pork chashu ramen was a lukewarm, tepid broth. I'm not sure what the red strands were in the broth but by golly they were bitter. I asked for spicy chili oil on the side....$1.50 extra...I didn't know I paid extra until I looked at the receipt! It's not the money but the principle

Beer is great. Dining way below average. Bartender was indifferent and failed to tell us about the specials. We only heard about these when he described them to our neighbor at the bar. Will not return. There are other breweries with great beer and good food.

Can't say I would recommend - not worth the prices. We spent $96 here for two people - that includes two meals and one appetizer, no drinks. For what we got, it was not worth it. The ambiance,service and food just didn't live up to the money that can be spent elsewhere. We both did get seafood, which contributes to the price , however my meal (Picante de Camarones) was mostly rice and beans. I just can't justify spending ~$30 on mostly rice and beans ( which were nothing too special). The sauces on our meals were pretty tasty, but mine was kind of bland. My dining partner enjoyed their meal, however they also agreed they would rather have spent ~$35 elsewhere. We ordered the tamale as an appetizer and it was $13 for a single tamale- also just okay. There was only one waitress so wait times were a little long. The ambiance does not nearly make up for the prices either. Kind of tacky interior & music seemed like it was playing from someone's personal playlist. Overall, I would not recommend coming here, as you will spend a lot of money for not a lot of value.

The proces were decent for how much food they gave. I ordered mapo tofu, and it just wasn't that. It was a brown sauce that was sweet - no spice at all and no option of tofu and ground pork. It was edible, but not what I wanted. They offer brown rice without upcharge which was nice. $8.45 for decent amount of general tso chicken, pork fried rice, and egg roll for dinner. Quick delivery. Just not the best I've had plus, they just don't make mapo.

We used to love going and ordering steak sandwiches and a basket of fries. Now the portions are much smaller and not worth the trip. Used to order a basket of fries and would split. Now comes on a tiny plate and are told that was only size. When one of our friends ordered a sandwich and his came with fries...larger portion than when ordering JUST fries. My friends that were loyal patrons (when they fly in from LA a bunch of us would meet here) have noticed the same thing. We won't be going back...unless things go back to normal.

Order was placed at 3:06P via mobile suppose to be ready at 3:12P didn't get served until 3:25P after I arrived at 3:10P waited and watched 6 people get served in front of me!!!! Called after I left talk to manger he apologized and let me know they were short staff.

Less than stellar experience, service was good everything else no. Ordered farmers platter out of ribs, back up prime rib out of that as well. Opted for fried chicken specified thighs, got three pieces of 95% breading with dried out white meat sent this back next three were just as bad (18.99 to boot!). Won't be returning any time soon. Really missed the mark.

The drinks were good. Bartender did his thing. Our waiter was personable and fun. But the food was lacking taste and heat. How do french fries come to the table lukewarm. My table mate said her chicken was overcooked, zapped too long in the microwave probably. My falafel was a crunchy dust ball. It was topped with what looked like ketchup. But the green salad it was on was fresh, it didn't have sauce but I guess the ketchup was the sauce. There was a side salad ordered by another table mate that was fresh. So they got the salad part right but they clearly need work in other areas.

First time at JD. Ordered take out: Kung pao chicken, shrimp Lomein, firecracker chicken, fried dumplings & eggrolls. Nothing was particularly great or good. Not sure we would order again, as everything was a bit dry & over cooked. On a positive note, they are punctual. We showed up 15 minutes early, as from past experiences with take out orders, the food is usually ready before we arrive & we were trying to avoid picking up cold food. The girl that works there made it clear that she did not appreciate us arriving early... she told us very curtly, as she handed us our order 15 minutes later, we should call next time if we want to pick up early. Very odd way to interact with a customer, since we never made a fuss upon arrival and told them we were happy to wait, cuz we knew we were 15 minutes early.

When did pizza become such a rip-off? For $30 I expected more than a long rectangle of chewy bread, a scant suggestion of sauce less toppings in the center, and a box with the precious Vetri name (even though he no longer owns it). The shape is for sure a clever way to increase the cheaper crust to pricier topping ratio. Really, people, buy a pizza stone and see how easy, cheap & fast it is to make excellent pizza yourself at home. You'll start calling these center city joints a rip-off too.
Gave them our number. Didn't receive text. We had only ordered fries and drinks. So after 20 minutes went up to ask. Then got cold fries and Luke warm sodas.

If you've been to the location in St. Pete ... keep going there; no need to try this one. Thank me later. -Bruschetta - Half soggy, half hard, bread didn't seem fresh. -Gnocchi - Better at the St. Pete location, and had quite a spice/kick to it here. *Chicken Piccata - They don't serve it at the Tampa location. *Lobster Mac - They don't serve it. May be seasonal. *Fries - Those were good. -Bread - I feel like St. Pete serves bread prior to meal. The Tampa location did not. -Blackberry Ginger Smash - It was good.
Didn't care for it. Cute concept & love the name but the chicken was overly seasoned. The fries were basic as well.

Chicago prices for sub par food. They start you out with some stale bread. In group of 6, Ordered 4 lackluster starters. Dry cardboard like truffle French fries, calamari that was basically just fried batter, escargot swimming in a butter bath. The pork belly that was just OK. But the waiter sure went on about how fantastic and perfect everything on the menu was. When the mains came, I found the sides to be unapealimy angus mid rare filet mignon over cooked but did have nice flavor. I should have sent it back but I was in a large party and at that point and was ready to move on with the evening.
Very generic Tex-mex with very pungent garlic. Only reason I gave it 2 stars was because the alcohol is pretty cheap.
I've come here every year for my birthday for the past 9 years. I was disappointed this year. Bring back the freshly baked bread. Pretzel bread does not taste well with oil and Parmesan cheese.

I haven't eaten my food yet so I am extra bitter and maybe rambling on. I ordered chicken flautas -- noting that I wanted EXTRA guacamole. Order arrives and obviously no extra guacamole. Ugh. Sometimes folks forget. Times is hard. I forget. So I called. They proceed to tell me that the flautas don't come with guacamole. That is why they charged me for it. That I am wrong. That it isn't on the menu. Ahhhhhh. Also missing is the shredded lettuce but I don't need that. Also also didn't get the correct salsa I asked for. But none of that matters to me. Just my guacamole. Give me my guacamole, you liars.

It's hard to find really tasty Chinese food. Combination fried rice, egg drop soup and low mein had zero flavor. I am giving 2 stars for the sesame chicken and chicken curry had a little more taste. The staff was super friendly but food lack spice and flavor.

I've come here at least 3 times now and have always had great service and decent food. However, I came here with my friend last night and they forgot to put whiskey in her whiskey sour, my food came out 20 minutes later than my friend so they had to reheat her dish while she waited for my food to come out, and we had to flag down other employees to tend to us as our waiter did not. The trout I ordered was also over salted. The espresso martini was pretty good though. For the price and expectation of this place I expect nothing less than a stellar experience; especially service-wise. Disappointed to say the least.

Disappointing...... We were excited to get a reservation on New Years Eve....even though they said sold out.....LOTS of empty tables..... 8pm......already out of their $5 Sourdough bread....so we order the flat bread....which was only a few slices....and drenched in oil....not good.... We ordered the oysters as an appetizer....the were the size of my thumb nail....and very fishy. You hate to complain, and ruin the mood on New Years Eve.....but we left very disappointed.....

Let me start off with the positive open late with a limited menu. Great friendly staff location has a good beer selection. The pizza appears to be good.. then I try it .. unfortunately the flavor from piece to piece varies drastically. The first piece was hard and burned on the bottom with almost no flavor with heavy sauce at the crust, not across the whole pie. Then the second piece was better more balanced and not burned. Late night downtown Indy choices are limited. Maybe your luck would be better maybe I just got a bad pie. Hmmmmm maybe next time it will be better.

We came here a couple of weeks back on a Saturday night. Rushed our dinner to get there before the 8pm closing time. At 7:45pm they were waving us off like flies saying too late the store had closed. So rude! It's Saturday night and we wanted an after dinner sweet. Will not be back. Crazy they shut so early anyway.

I am sorry to share a poor review about this business but we have choices to make when we get something to eat at a restaurant. Not sure if new owners need to step up the quality but the pizza was poor at best! I hope this restaurant will improve because of it's location is convenient. Give it a try. Beware!

This buffet isn't anything special. The food was subpar but the server was nice and attentive. We were surprised at the lack of offerings; pretty standard Chinese fare. For comparison, we ate at another Chinese buffet in Nampa where they have a huge spread. We found the desserts sorely lacking so we stuck with the soft serve ice cream machine. Their fruit offerings are pretty good. The chow mein was bland and the egg rolls were greasy. Lack of beef dishes as well. We were extremely surprised when we walked in that the prices were not advertised. We did our homework before we chose the restaurant and saw that on their website a weekday lunch is listed at $9.75. As soon as the server brought us or drinks she also left the check. To our dismay we were being charged $13.25 each which is the dinner price. We called the server over and asked her about the price and she said because it's a holiday. We didn't go on Thanksgiving or Easter; we went on MLK day. Totally ridiculous and price gouging! We are definitely one and done with this place!

Outrageous wait times even when there are many open tables and servers. We waited in line for 30 minutes just to be told it'll be an additional 30 minutes when there was 4 servers. The same thing happened to our party on a previous day when we tried to eat here, but then we were told it would be an additional hour on top of what we had already spent in line. Just go somewhere else to eat, you'll be back in the same amount of time.
The food is a no for me. Flavorless. Only up side about this place is they're open late on a weeknight and if you're starved you can get some bland food.

Service was good, but food was not! I rarely write reviews, but had to share. My favorite salad is the Chicken quesadilla explosion salad. So, I know how it should look when it comes out. However, it was not recognizable and I told the server that's not what I ordered. She assured me it was, but it had very little lettuce, which was not fresh and it was already drenched with salad dressing. It was covered with sliced chicken, tons of overcooked tortilla strips and worst of all the cheese quesadilla triangles looked like they were left out overnight and place on the plate. I told the server my issues and she apologized, but I don't feel comfortable returning to this location.

I expected more during our first experience at Carlucci's for dinner. Service was sub par and the indoor space is a little outdated however, comfortable. Food and drinks were OK but nothing to remember because it seemed overpriced.

The Campbell location is an excellent, well-managed cafe with exceptional food and staff. We tried the Broadway location today. The food was mediocre in comparison and the service...what service? There are better places. Go to the Campbell location or try Bisquits a few doors down. Much better elsewhere.

I had high hopes and ordered the Pho, but what a disappointment. It was luke warm and was basically water and noodles. I took it back and asked them for flavor and they said they forgot the broth flavoring. The staff added the broth and I added hoisin and sriracha, yet it was still terrible. A friend ordered another item and it was subpar too. Lastly, for a name like Lil Dumplings you would expect more options with dumplings. They only had three choices , but out of two.

Do you like a salty Pizza? Took out two large plains...Don't know at what part of the process some genius decided to make the finished product overly salty.... but that what it is. Did they get the wrong high schooler preparing the sauce this time... I can only guess... result for my family.. high sodium pizza. imo.. not safe for older folks..
It used to be good before the plannedemic 2020. Food is extra greasy now. Meat doesn't taste fresh like it used to be. Rice even tastes fake.

The poor girl behind the counter has been slaving over online orders and walk-in orders for 20 minutes now. There's 4 of us in line, it shouldn't take this long. There shouldn't be just one employee handling all of this. Hire more employees and stop running out of fish (at a poke place) before 7pm. Step it up.

I honestly cannot give Great Basin Brewing a good review. I wanted to like it since new ownership took over however my fish & chips & fries all were served cold, my husbands burger served cold. I informed the waitress and she microwaved my fish; It just made it soggy. The manager was kind enough to take it off my bill. I was so craving tasteful fish & chips this was definitely not the place for that. This is no Liberty on Sierra Street.

It doesn't look like much when you walk by it, but when you get your food... you're right. It's nothing spectacular and they were out of a lot of things, like hash browns, spinach, and a few others. The coffee was pretty bad, but the music was the only thing that kept me from leaving. The pancakes were alright, but again, nothing special. The service was pretty slow, and usually the food makes up for it, but not in this case. The only thing that was special about this place was their band, but you can listen to them without eating there. If you do go here, if they are playing, tip the band. They deserve it!

They aren't getting things right the last few times we've been there. They keep forgetting things in the bag. Another example just recently ordered egg and cheese biscuit, spicy chicken biscuit, 3 hashbrowns. Got home only got two sandwiches had to run back up to get the hashbrowns got back home and wish would have opened up sandwiches cause got two reg chicken biscuits. The order on the bag had two stickers with exactly the order but none of the right food. Happening a lot there lately and super frustrating! Hashbrowns soggy and cold and one was barely filled...geesh

It's a pretty location, seems inviting until you get asked by the host to be sat at the bar, there's no one in the restaurant, we sit for 10 minutes at our table and have multiple people including the bartender walk by and glance our way. Instead of asking to be sat somewhere else I see 4 servers and the host just chilling at the host stand doing nothing so we left. Food smelled great and I'm sure the drinks were good but I'd pass this location by.

I do not know how this place got such. High Yelp review. The restaurant itself is super tiny and cold. It was probably warmer outside. Eating our food wasn't enjoyable just because of how cold it was. I got the brown sugar boba. I don't know if it tasted like Soap or what. It wasn't good. Definitely wasn't sweet. If you want some good brown sugar boba, go to Whale Tea. Also, the boba itself wasn't even that good. They just had it in a container. I got the garlic chicken ramen. Absolutely so flavor. The chicken pieces had no flavor. Once I added Sriracha to it, it tasted way better, but I shouldn't have to add that for it to taste good. This place looks like it should be in the food court in the mall. We know the quality there.

The pasta here is just aggressively mediocre. We were really excited because of how great the pictures were, but it genuinely was just "ok". Paying $18 for mediocre pasta is a huge letdown. I got the penne a la vodka, and it lacked any flavor at all. Watered down, salt less, I had to bury the dish in pepper and red pepper to taste anything at all. We also got a spaghetti, and the noodles were over cooked and the sauce tasted very odd, almost earthy? Overall, I'm really disappointed with the food. Our waitress was very kind though!

I phoned the order in and was told food would be ready in 16 mins. We arrived about 20 mins later and the pizza was not even in the oven. Had to wait about another 25 mins. The wings were very good but the sauce on the pizza is a sweeter taste than we were used to but also had a spicy bite. I would not recommend this restaurant.

So sad. I grew up in south STL and the Imo's out there and back then was the place to go. The pizzas, the meatball sandwich and hot roast beef..all fire. This location and overall the brand of Imo's has deteriorated so much over the years. I hate to say this, but STL Pizza and Wings is so much better and way more reasonable on price. Sorry Imo's. You're nit the same anymore.

I just stopped in to Homage for a chai latte. I haven't been there in years, but I like supporting local, and I was in the neighborhood. Sadly, it was one of the weakest chai teas I've ever had. Little flavor, no spice added, and not as hot as I would like on this chilly morning. Their pastries looked amazing, there were quite a few people seated inside, and the staff was pleasant. Disappointed with my "spiced" chai tea.

We went to Nunzio's for a date night, but unfortunately we had to wait over an hour for our food when there were many tables still open. The food is great, but the lack of awareness from our server and the wait time for the food was not worth it.

I wanted this to be a place for me to frequent like Floras down the street. Nope. It's expensive. Don't get me wrong, I will PAY for a good dinner, but I went in to get dinner and I paid $18 for a salad. It was dinner. It was $18. I expected a dinner-salad. What I got was a pre-entre salad that did not stand up to the $18 price tag. A similar salad found at Wildflower for instance is $10. And that salad, I went wow, this is good! Tucson is a City of gastronomy--https://tucson.cityofgastronomy.org/about-- so there are a lot of quality dining options out there. I don't think this place will fare well with the $$$ price tag and the lack of quantity and quality of their food. If your staying at the Doubletree, venture out, Tucson has WAY more better options. Also, had our waitress not treated us like I was bothering her during our interactions, I would have been happy to tell her my thoughts in person instead of here...

We arrived before 6 on a Thursday evening and were quickly seated inside. Our meals were okay; nothing to highly recommend but big portions. However it was SO crowded and SO loud that we couldn't wait to get out of there! Not recommended
Oh boy. So I paid $40 for 2 burgers an order of fries. The burgers were not special. I think I let a little tear go when I signed the check.
Had high hopes, but very overpriced ramen for the quality and quantity. If I'm going to pay nearly $20 for a bowl I expect it to be top of the line and this place has dissapointed me every time :(

Overall, we weren't impressed whatsoever. We placed our order online and we're hopeful for large portions given our extremely high ticket price. We got a few choices of meats and 5 different sides. The meat...pulled pork was incredibly dry. Like was this left over from the weekend? The beef brisket... it came in a round container which concerned me..when I opened it, imagine pulled pot roast. Zero smoke flavor and dry beyond our preference. My wife was looking forward to good brisket only to be very disappointed. The smoked sausage, best thing we tried but small portioned for what we were charged. The sides...oh the sides. Why is everyone afraid of seasoning? Literally where is the salt and pepper at least? Mac and cheese, boxed flavor. Green beans, bland. Slaw, blah. Baked beans, tasted like beans with a bottle of bbq sauce squeezed into them. Brunswick stew was like eating leftover stew that someone tried to spice up with more bbq sauce. Will we be back? Maybe. Recommend to friends, no. Worth the price you pay, absolutely not.

Confusing menu, food isn't much to write home about. I've had a lot of sushi but would rate this sushi as disappointing. It's not bad by any means, just not worth your time when there are better options nearby. The portions were generous, however.

Three years after my earlier review, and nothing seems to have improved. This time I skipped the "meat and three", and decided to see how they would do with that "All-American" favorite, the cheeseburger and fries. First, the good part. The french fries, even though they were obviously previously frozen, were excellent. They were served hot, slightly crisp on the outside, perfectly done on the inside. But the sad part was that the burger wasn't as good as any you could get at the fast food joints just off the Interstate. Disecting it, patty looked fresh, but was completely devoid of flavor. Apparently they didn't even have salt or pepper. One last comment: the coffee was just dreadful. It tasted like they used whatever they could get at the lowest possible price. C'mon folks. At least try to get the coffee right.

I understand making mistakes with a sandwich but I would bet money that both employees were high as a kite when my daughter and I came in today. Ingredients were added to a sandwich that were never mentioned, others that were requested were left off completely, and I've never seen someone make a sandwich so slowly. Don't go to work high, kids. Customers can definitely tell even if you think they can't.

Did the "when in Philly, get a Philly cheesesteak" thing. Hate to say it, don't love Genos. First time I had a cheesesteak with sliced meat instead of shredded. Also the last time I will have a cheesesteak with sliced meat instead to shredded. What an odd concept. I will say the employees were kind and extremely fast at getting the food out so kudos to them. The cheesesteak was so basic. Just a slice of cheese, thick slices of tomatoes, a ton of onions, and let's hear it, sliced meat. Wish it was more cut up and mixed around and blended together but I suppose when you are Genos, quantity is more important than quality.

Cute atmosphere, food is not very good. Idk why this place has so many stars. Salad was SO over dressed I couldn't even eat any of it. Chicken is that disgusting chewy chicken you dread getting served. Skip

I want to like this place... But the service and staff just kind of suck... Honestly they could seem to care less on the product they put out... I don't think I've had a hot taco yet... Which is sad because I think of many of them could be better if they were served fresher and with a little care... honestly Del taco and Taco Bell serve warmer fresher and better put together tacos and we've all seen what they look like...The beans with the green stuff in them I don't know what that is but it's not Mexican food... Not even edible to me Imho
Came early on New Years Eve. Waitress was fantastic. Food was pretty subpar. For some reason the hostess felt the need to correct my husband of 36 years on who should go first. Crazy
Live music was great. That's all I can say because I sat here for an hour without being helped. Finally caved and got a drink from the bar. Came for the "free sunset shooter" that never happened.

Usually always happy with the seafood trio. This time not so much. Very skimpy on the seafood, barely a octopus leg if reconstructed. A few shrimps and a few scallops. Very sad. They piled in the sides to fill the plate. I understand prices have gone up but this was very disappointing.

I'm really disappointed in Shokku Ramen. When a ramen place opened up so near my home AND they promised to have Miracle Noodles on the menu (I would have been fine with any gluten-free noodle but I was especially excited to try those), I was so thrilled. I went one time early last summer (before I became more seriously gluten free out of medical necessity) and was told after an incredibly long wait that they were "working on their staffing issues" and that they would have the noodles "soon." It's been over six months, yet the company is still saying the same thing about staff and the noodles have been taken off the menu altogether for a few months now. Thoroughly annoyed with their lack of inclination to make actual changes... especially in a neighborhood like Hillsboro Village. What a letdown.

Let me start by saying Central Taco & Tequila is a nice, stylish, well lit and clean restaurant with a very nice staff. If you're looking for Mexican-ish or Mexican-style food then you will LOVE this establishment. However, my girlfriend and I were under the impression that we would be eating actual Mexican food and that was were things fell apart. Putting beans, rice and meat in a tortilla may add up to "Mexican food" on paper, but I can say with absolute certainty that there is not one Mexican chef, owner or other employee that is involved with making this food. Eating here is like doing Taco Tuesday over your white best friends parents house in middle school. I'm quite confident our burritos were from an El Paso kit found in the "ethnic aisle" at Shop Rite. The guacamole tasted like it was squeezed from a plastic package. If it were made on the premises I'm not sure if that would be better or worse. It just had no flavor and no soul. If you're dropping in for a drink on happy hour, they have some nice beers and tequila flights, but if you want Mexican food, an assembly line Chipotle burrito feels infinitely more autenticó. If for strange reason the Cartel came to Haddon Township and had to eat this food, they would almost certainly dismember anyone involved with making it. Two stars.

We were not pleased at all. The biscuits were small and hard. The glaze was ok, but where was the cinnamon? I especially wanted to try them because I heard good things. When my hubby walked in to pick up our order, ( I had called ahead!) they weren't ready and the young man just grabbed them, poured the glaze over them and that was that! It was 90 min before closing time, but they were in a rush to close! Not sure if we'll try them again!

We have been to Sunset Sushi on numerous occasions. Normally the food and service is good. The past two occasions were terrible. Tonight we arrived at 5:15 and were the first people seated. We promptly ordered. It took over a hour to get our food. We saw other people get up and leave. At a minimum the management should have taken something off the bill. Will not be back.

Interestingly we've been here a few times, normally one of our stops for dinner while in town, however, this time was absolutely not great. Bland over cooked food, poor service, and sub par in general, not a good look for the most expensive steak house open with expectations of such. When the waiter clears you plate still full of food and fails to even ask if everything was ok, tells me they don't care. This will more than likely be my last visit to Luckys, there are just too many restaurants that are doing good things to pay supremely overpriced fares for lackluster food

I was so excited to try this place in Reading Terminal as I had heard rave reviews and saw the line wrapping around the shop. Sadly the food did not live up to the hype. I got the classic roast pork sandwich they are known for. The pork itself was dry and not juicy enough, The broccoli rabe added a slight mustardy taste that did not complement the rest of the sandwich. Overall, it was just an okay sandwich. I found it quite bland and it definitely could've used more sauce or something to add flavor.

I won't name the server by name but he needs more training! He was nice but NEEDS more training! Place wasn't even half full. 8pm. He had 2 tables. 3 total people to help. I asked for water 3x. Asked for green tea. Never got it. Never got water either. Got the water from someone else. 20 mins later he asks if he can get me anything else. I say some water please! Told him he forgot the tea. He was nice about it but left it on the bill. He took it off. Left me with no pen for 10 more mins. Ugh!!! Train him! You pay for the food AND the experience. Make it better. --Sushi was good. Calamari was way different than in the menu. (See photos)

Food is ok but has no spice or real flavor. It is obviously catering to a specific type of white person that lives in this area. Bland flavorless food with mediocre service. Depending on the day you will find the staff less than friendly. We all have bad days but it seems they're just bitchy a lot. Definitely don't consider this Mexican food but more of a white man's TexMex.

The location is great. The build is new and nice. The signage is eye catching and bring people in. The decor is typical. The photos of the family traveling is a neat idea. The menu has a good variety. Food is definitely Americanized. The food is just average. The chips and salsa are extra and the guacamole seemed a little over priced but I'm not sure how much avocados cost in Idaho. The actual meals were just okay. I have eaten here twice now and not impressed. The kitchen sink burrito was not good. Unfortunately it tasted just like it's name. Sounds mean but my 13 year old cooks better than that. It was busy on the inside and was difficult to find a table. There was a super large group that had no common courtesy and acted like they were the only people in the world. They had already finished and were just hanging out and talking. They had no responsibility for their kids and they were running around inside like it was a playground. This part was not really in control of the business but they could have maybe mentioned for them to leave when completing their meal so others who had ordered could sit down and enjoy their meal. And to not let their kids run around bothering others. I have a family four kids but would never let them be disrespectful to others and behave in such a manner.
The place went completely downhill after Covid. The ingredients are not the same. They no longer have the Red Fish. The menu doesn't have much on it as they use to. I won't be going here anymore

Visiting from out of the area. Soup du jour was cauliflower scallop. Delicious! Except there was no detectable cauliflower. Tasted like cream of mushroom with some scallops thrown in. Entree was medallions of veal with potatoes Anna. Veg was a mixture of tomatoes, mushrooms & kale. Veal was poorly trimmed...raggedy hunk hanging off one, fat blob on another. And, sadly, overcooked and a bit tough. The potatoes & veg were poorly seasoned. No detectable salt in one bite, overwhelming amounts in the next. The potatoes were dry as a bone. Dessert was the Grand Mariner soufflé. Beautifully baked and looked wonderful. Horribly sweet and a total miss. Wouldn't recommend and would never go back. Service wasn't great either. Very long waits, no offer of coffee or a second glass of wine and we had to push our dishes across the table to hint they they needed picking up.

I wanted to like this place. I was following them for a long time on instagram and finally had time to go in. I thought the ambiance was alright. Very tight space and does need a deep clean. The food was very mid. Too much frozen stuff for me.

We ordered food for delivery. It took 2-1/2 hours to get delivered. I've ordered from here for the past 6 years. Not even a phone to let me know what's going on. I even called and she said they were backed up. I asked if my order had even been out for delivery yet. This 1-1/2 after my order. She said she didn't know.
ordered pick up with door dash my gravy was liquid not thick at all. The rest of the food does look good though.

You guys got rid of a lot of great things on the menu. I was very disappointed when I could not order the beef stroganoff or even pizza. Only ordered drinks and then left. This used to be a go to place but not anymore.

Service was great, but the food was meh. I ordered the Western omelette and the onion and peppers were kind of raw. The pancakes my partner ordered upset both of our stomachs (either that or it was the water). Utensils were also a little dirty. Standard diner with room for improvement. The server was wearing a face mask the entire time, and the booths are distanced/separated, which we appreciated

We select Pearl based on a local. Allowing for slower service, most restaurants are short staffed, we still found service lacking. Apps came with no one to check on us, and we ordered salads with dressing on the side, not an unreasonable request for an upscale restaurant.- Salad came drenched in dressing and two upcharge Caesar's came with tired brown lettuce (sent back). The fish special was OK, but a very small portion and at $52.00 disappointing. My daughter ordered seafood pasta which had a decidedly strong unpleasant aroma, not sure if was the spice or fish. Overall dinner for four with 2 glasses of wine was about $300.... we are not going back.

Placed our order through Grubhub at 6 pm on a Friday for 1 pasta dish and 1 pizza. Estimated 45-50 min wait time. After 45 mins, got a notice that they accidentally gave our order to someone else. Mistakes happen. But it took another 50 minutes for them to remake and deliver our order. Disappointing that we didn't get our order prioritized (shouldn't take 50 mins to make 1 pizza and 1 pasta dish and deliver it 7 minutes away). When I called to ask about the long wait and check on my order (1.5 hours after I placed my order), I was told they only had 2 hostesses instead of 3 working that night. While it did sound busy in the restaurant, it shouldn't take 3 hostesses to ensure the right orders are picked up, nor do hostesses make the actual food or prioritize the orders. When then food did arrive, the pizza was cold and lacking in flavor. The pasta was warm but also lacking in overall flavor. Order local (Bar Sera, Bar Luca, Pepperoncini's in Conshy or Pietro's in Radnor) for better service and quality. Management needs to step up the game if they want their chain to compete with other options in the area with food that is as good or better and with better service. This could be the outlier but we won't be ordering again.

Ok, so I only way the ravioli sometimes I get some fries Now there's this new thing you can only order online , here's the thing ONLINE YOU MUST SIGN INTO TO SOME ACCOUNTS, and everything you want is NOT even there to order .. for example (plain fries/ small salad/house salad).. it's realllll hard to give my money to them at this point .. and you can just give up trying to get someone on the phone because that's not going to happen .. whoever's idea this only online thingy was must not have been thinking AT ALL that day ..

I don't hate it here, but I definitely don't love it. Came in on a Friday lunch and the place was dead. Took about 20 minutes just to get some rum drink with an extra "floater" that tasted like straight cranberry juice and sugar. Opted to get a beer flight after 2 sips of my drink. Beer flight was good, okay selection of beers. We ordered a crab rangoon dip as an appetizer and felt like we were just eating warmed cream cheese - NOTHING close to those delicious pockets of crabby goodness you'd normally get! The 2 things this place has going for it are the open air concept on both floors and their lobster roll. Lobster was fresh and plentiful on the roll. Good taste and perfect size!

When you order pad Thai, you might expect a peanut sauce and that traditional dish you get from a Thai restaurant, but that's not what Thai Kitchen will serve you. It's a bit more of a sweet teriyaki thing. Pretty over seasoned so by the time you get to the bottom, it's a little much. Kind of gut bomb-y. Can't say I'd go back, but I think the college crowd loves it.

Currently sitting in the drive thru...24 minutes the longest wait ever! The van in front of us took up 15 minutes ordering, meanwhile in the right lane 4 cars already went thru. The difference between this visit and others, there is no one out there taking orders. Never again.

Located at the end of B Terminal, social distancing seems to be a thing of the past, all customers shoved on one side of the restaurant. Only breakfast at 10:30a. Bland shrimp and grits. Wait staff seems bored and unfamiliar with "If you can lean, you can clean". But you are trapped. Metaphorically.

I'll be honest, I'm not a fan of the chain. There's better local options here in Nashville. I haven't been to a PF Chang's in easily a decade but we met another couple here at their request to have dinner. The Mu Shoo Chicken is no longer in the menu which is what I ordered so I opted for the pad Thai chicken and was left disappointed as there was zero flavor to it. Go to Deg Thai or Smiling Elephant or Soy Bistro if you want actually great food cooked well with flavor and seasoned. The wait was long even with a reservation, as we got seated a half hour after our call ahead time and the service was okay at best. Next time we'll recommend going to our local faves when meeting these friends rather than waste our time and money with lackluster food.

On my quest to find a good liver dish with nice wine in Philly, I ventured to Jake's. Upon entering, I was calmed by the dim(ish) lights, warm colored walls, and low music. A relaxed but semi-fancy atmosphere, depending on where you'd sit. The Boudreaux wine we ordered was quite delectable- dry, not too sweet, and a woodsy aftertaste- however, that was the end of my meal's delight. The "calve" (it's calf!) liver I ordered medium was well-done with no pink, and was served atop an apple potato salad you would get made by your aunt that can't cook at a family picnic. I get they were trying to be clever - liver and "caramelized" onions (which had 0 flavor, barely cooked, and caramelized onions are usually my favorite salty topping to ANY savory dish) with apple - but the flavors mixed together sabotaged each other. On their own, each was not too shabby. Additionally, the portobello mushroom soup was nothing to call home about - it reminded me of the Campell's can of cream of mushroom soup your parents would force you to eat as a kid. My boyfriend's slow-cooked pork was the best (and only) amazing item I tried that night- for the prices (30$ for a sub-par liver and the equivalent of one small white potato) I think this place is overrated, and would call this diner quality food (no offense to diners) at a romantic atmosphere restaurant.

It was okay. We made a reservation for a Monday which was totally unnecessary but it is what it is. The menu online did not reflect the menu in the restaurant but we were fine with that. We decided to get fried alligator as an app (free with a Yelp check-in!) and it was super chewy with too much breading. For my entree I had the crawfish pasta. The entree was very good but could have used more crawfish. Our drinks were very weak. Our waiter was disengaged. The manager who helped with the free app was nice. The hostess wanted to be anywhere but there. Still giving three stars because it's still a pandemic yada yada.

After visiting a handful of times over the past year or so I would put edison at 3.5 stars (rounding down to 3 due to the pricing). The service is consistently very good and the creativity is commendable but something about the food always leaves me wanting. I read the menu and am always intrigued and excited by the combinations but then the food comes and it feels like something is missing. After the 20+ dishes I have tried I can say that nothing has ever been "bad" (no small feat given some of the combinations they pull off), but also nothing has ever been DELICIOUS. At the end of the day the day the dishes are more memorable on the page than on the palate. Will be interesting to see what Michelin makes of edison later this year. Lastly, I'll say that the price increases are obscene. Some dishes have nearly doubled in price since our first visit. The food is simply not good enough, nor generous enough to justify the current price. After our most recent visit, our group went for burgers given we were still hungry and not willing to spend $100 per person at dinner. I'm sympathetic to food costs, supply chain, labor costs etc. however we regularly eat out at other leading restaurants in the area and have not had this experience anywhere else. I hope they can figure out their sourcing.

I always enjoy the food, but every time I go to get food the guy behind the counter never responds or communicates and just walks away. You don't see him again until he brings you your food. Even when ordering to go, it'd be nice to know if it's going to be a few more minutes before it's ready, rather than retreating to the kitchen without any info. It's a small thing that makes a BIG difference.

The salads are excellent crisp and large. The pizza however is always undercooked and soggy at the center. The toppings are incredibly abundant a result of too much sauce and if ordering anything with vegetable topping the same issue is even worse.
