Be prepared to pop the pizza on to your own preheated oven pizza stone and bake a bit more which helps. Or perhaps recook each slice in a non stick pan. Regrettably this is the problem which is a shame. Never ordered anything else beyond salad and pizza. In person service is hyper to order and takes a normal time to bring out. The and the staff are loud and live in their own world with annoying music and shenanigans. They are oblivious to how weird they come across.
Run of the mill diner. Nice place to stop by for a late-night dinner as it is open 24 hours. The food is just okay, but that is to be expected. Our waitress was nice.

DELICIOUS FOOD!!! It's a Tucson Gem. Truly one of the last few great spots to get authentic food. I like the sushi however I sat at the bar once (I've been going here for years) and I really lost my appetite after seeing the way the sushi chefs were not sanitary at all. I also noticed one of the sushi chefs go to the bathroom with his gloves on and walked out with them on and still went straight back to work. I was in shock and ended up ordering Ramen instead. The SERVICE though is truly wonderful. The ladies who are waitresses are fantastic.

From the music to the Aloha greetings when you walk in, they really attempt to give you a Hawaiian vibe in the restaurant and I'll give them credit for that. Unfortunately, the sushi isn't that great. I've lived in Hawaii so I know good fish and this just isn't it. I don't even think it's as good as some that I've had on the mainland. It's worth a try, but don't be surprised if you're disappointed.

Let me start by saying that everyone from the hostess to the waiter were amazing, I just wish the food was as great as the staff. The Gumbo was lacking in substance and flavor. The jambalaya was could and the rice was over cooked and mushy. The Red Beans were Amazing! The cocktail was fun but weak.

Very friendly service, but took quite a while for the food to come out. Food was ok (chile relleno). The ice tea was bad. The water used had a bad flavor and overpowered the tea. Small setting and the couple next to us didn't know a vocabulary beyond the f word. Not the restaurant's fault, but certainly interfered with our meal. Not sure I'll return.

The food and service on New Year's Eve was excellent. That said, we paid much more than we expected to pay for dinner, partially because we didn't get a text telling us about the special menu and $124 per person for New Year's Eve because my husband's cell phone had been stolen. I did receive a reminder email from Yelp on 12/29 but it reinforced the $49 meal price. Since the price included wine pairings, it wasn't unreasonable. But my husband doesn't like wine so we probably would have cancelled had we known. While the problem with the text wasn't the restaurant's fault, I do have an issue with the 20 percent ($50) Fourking Fee we were charged on top of the 20 percent tip. There was no mention of this extra fee anywhere I can find in the text or on the website. All-in-all, two dinners with wine and a beer cost $379.

Our food order was deserving of five stars. My husband ordered the Pad Thai (his favorite) and I had the chicken fried rice. Both were served piping hot and full of flavor. Our service though was INTENSE. Our waitress had zero patience as we placed our order, although we knew what we wanted to order she was walking away as we were still explaining the specifics of our order. She did this again when we had a request for condiments. She wouldn't slow down long enough to listen to us and by the time she returned with what we needed, we were finished eating and looking for our bill. This is truly one of our favorite places to eat, I just hope we never get this server again.

Drink selection here is probably a 4/5 but so/so quality bar food with an exceptionally long wait every time I'm here lately. The turnaround times for entrees is also insanely long and on more than one occasion I've had subpar attitudes from waiters here. The beer variety is their truly redeeming quality and they do a good job sourcing from local brewers!

The bar is Christmas themed. I got the Grinch shot and another drink in a Santa boot. Paid about 35-40 bucks for both and that's including the tip I added for the bartender. Both drinks were very sweet not enough to get you tipsy. If you're looking for a fun place to meet your friends to start the night Tinsel is it. The staff was friendly and the holiday chair was the perfect instagram photo spot. If you're worried about Covid no one wears masks inside. It's very crowded on the weekend and they do check to confirm everyone has been vaccinated. Better late than never but happy holidays.

I heard about this historic place that you HAVE to eat at if you visit New Orleans, so we came. The atmosphere and nostalgia behind this place is what earned it the 3 stars. The food was nothing special or anything that made the hype worth it. It's your average southern food joint. I was prepared to have my eyes rolling in the back of head after the first bite, but that wasn't the case. By no means was it nasty, it just wasn't delicious. If you're going to visit, do so, but don't be expect to have your taste buds blown away.

We came in for dinner during a snow storm and when we were there we saw a fun band play some bluegrass music and they were very good. The restaurant got very busy once the band started playing and the place is small so it was a bit loud. We ordered the sweet potato hush puppies, which were pretty good, and we had the half chicken and burger for dinner. The chicken was good but it came with croutons and cold tomatoes for the "vegetable" so we had to order another item due to the plate being quite small. The chicken was good but it was a little expensive for what we got.

Started price gouging! I've been eating here for at least a decade. Prices have always been fair and Gyros are great. Inflation sucks and is a part of life in 2022...but Gyroshack got greedy. 36% increase. Sorry, you'll need to resolve your business model as I'm not paying $8 for a Gyro...no other fast food has gone up 36%, you're being greedy. Ironically as other reviews have mentioned, they don't even pay their employees enough ($7.50) to eat at their own restaurant! When you're driving slave labor and implementing massive price increases you know this establishment has jumped the shark. Interesting to hear they have fairly new ownership...go figure.

This was more like 2.5 stars but I rounded up for the fries. I saw this on Uber Eats and this is right around where we live so I thought I would give it a try. Ordered the Philly cheesesteak for my husband and I got the Dagwood. The wheat bread was over toasted and dried out. Meat was not a substantial enough amount. Condiments and toppings were actually good and fresh. The fact that they have fresh cut fries was nice because sometimes you just don't want chips. Probably wouldn't go back.

First time and was excited to try THE CAFE DU MONDE beignets. However, when we arrived the line wrapped around. We had to wait 30+ minutes in the cold before we can place our order. Keep in mind that this location accepts cash only. The tables and chairs are not really cleaned throughout after people leave so beware. We order one order of the beignets which comes with 3 pieces. When we open the bag, the beignets looks disappointing and not the puffy cloud beignets it was supposed to be. It looks just like random blobs. However, it taste amazing! Please keep in mind that there are many locations of Cafe Du Monde in NOLA so I would recommend checking the other locations if you don't mind not going to the original location.

Went one night for a quick bite and drinks! Wings were amazing! Like really good. Also for a burger off HH menu. Was supposed to come with lettuce and tomato and had no tomato. Asked to be cooked medium and came out Med well to well done. All in all...go for the wings.

Came on a weekday for lunch around 11:30AM, not too crowded, private parking lot in the back, has outdoor seating. Got the Tuck Special, didn't realize it didn't come with sides and is a sandwich. Flavor was quite delicious from the pimento cheese and sauce, but the brisket wasn't anything special. It was a bit hard and not flavorful at all, and I added a bunch of the BBQ sauce on the table to it. Mac and cheese was a bit sweet or something, somewhat odd. Really liked the grits though!

Kind of a major tourist trap here but you gotta have a cheesesteak when in Philly. Located near the Ben Franklin museum, this was very quick and easy after a long morning of museums. Lots of options on the cheese so take a step back and really take a look at the menu. Ordering felt a little rushed. We had the classic cheesesteak. Wished we mixed it up a little. The fries were fresh. If I could have just had a beer with it, it would have been perfect!

We sat outdoors, and I have to say, the setting is wonderful. Right in the middle of all the action, with the glorious St. Pete waterfront right across the way. Our server Chase was charming and attentive. The smoked salmon sandwich was out of this world. But the shrimp po'boy was such a disappointment. It's not a po'boy if it is not on a French roll, and this was on a ciabatta roll and a stale one at that. Inexcusable. We travel all over the country and it really is hard to find a great mid-priced restaurant. I had high hopes for this place but no, it fell short. We had to wait 20 or 30 min for a table and we saw several empty, unbussed tables. It was okay, we walked around the park in the sunshine and with every business short-handed these days I really can't hold that against them.

Ok disclaimer that this review may be unpopular but it is my opinion only. We were staying in the area and had heard about this bakery which was known for some great breakfast sandwich items so we stopped by. We ordered the breakfast sandwich and the crispy chicken sandwich. Breakfast sandwich: 3/5 Reading the reviews I was excited to try it. As the reviews mention the egg is perfectly soft. What I found lacking was any flavor. The brioche bread was not as buttery or sweet as others I have had and I was just expecting more. Chicken sandwich: 4/5 After taking my first bite I was underwhelmed but realized what the problem was. The bacon is too chewy and distracts from the perfectly crisp on the outside and tender on the inside chicken. So I removed the bacon and took my second bite and loved the sandwich. I would order the chicken sandwich with the bacon on the side. I wish the bacon pieces were thinner and crispier.
Love me some Oscar's. But, if you're going to offer breakfast burritos in the menu, maybe be open during breakfast hours?

The food and drinks here are solid, but the wait time for food was obscene. Our reservation was on a Friday night at 7:15pm. The appetizers and drinks came out reasonably quickly, but did not get our entrees until closer to 9:30pm, maybe an hour and a half after appetizers came.

I'm torn on this place - we were really hoping for a great experience. Our waiter was wonderful. Very attentive and one of the only reasons we would give another try. Steak was very very underwhelming and not cooked to the right temperature. Fish dish was just meh. The bill was crazy expensive for such subpar food, but I just can't help thinking we should try just one more time. First experience definitely missed the mark on the food.

The food was good and the service was adequate if not slow. The Prosecco, beet and citrus terrine, and crème brûlée was great and we should have stopped there. We spent more time waiting for food, to take orders, and the bill than we did eating and drinking. When a plate of food is served, the protein should face the diner so they don't have to use their napkin to turn around a screaming hot plate in order to eat their food. We ordered Prosecco and the menu (with wine list) was taken. We eventually asked another waiter for a wine list and apparently the fact it was on the table again wasn't hint enough. But then we never saw our waiter again before another server delivered the food. Apparently wine was not an option for us. Hint: we wanted wine. Did I not realize it's a self serve joint? We were seated immediately next to the entrance of the outdoor seating area (very nice), where apparently 3-4 servers decide to hang out while while waiting for something to do. While all seemed very nice, not exactly great ambiance compared to others who were seated further down, and frankly, seemed to get more attention. Three scallops, mashed potato's and asparagus for $45 seems a bit overpriced even in this area and at that service level is a really disappointing. We finally asked for the bill so we could get up and leave.

The restaurant has a nice atmosphere, nice & fancy set up. Parking is ok, the area gets crowded but if you're patient you'll get a parking space. Service was decent, despite us being place way back of the restaurant. Everyone but me enjoyed their food. I'm not sure I'll be back.
Can be a little hit or miss, but you definitely need to eat in here rather than get takeout. The vibes are great and the beer selection is awesome

Well gotta say this was my first trip in and I wasn't overly thrilled I ordered a large burrito the pork verde one while it was big and hot there wasn't much meat in it the flavor of the meat was also bland it was nearly all rice past that I'd give it maybe 4 out of 10. Service was quick though...

Ate here about a week ago. Our server was great and very attentive. My hubby and I ordered the beef fajitas. I only got 3 small one inch pieces of lettuce and small amount of pico. The guac was fantastic as it has been in prior visits. The steak was cooked well, but over seasoned. Limited menu compared to the past and beer selections very limited.

We happened upon Blanco Cocina + Cantina on December 30th 2021... and I'm so glad we did. We were in town to watch our Purdue Boilermakers take on the Tennessee Volunteers in the Music City Bowl. It was a beautiful day, and we needed to fuel-up before the big game. This attractive restaurant is right on Broadway. I would not call this an authentic Mexican restaurant; but rather an upscale, Americanized, Mexican restaurant. Our waiter was very nice, and hustled his butt off. He mentioned they are known for their Short Rib Machaca meat. I ordered The Tucson Chimichanga with ... (you guessed it) Short Rib Machaca. It had good flavor but the meat was a little too mushy. It came with rice and beans. I loved the rice! My wife had The Little Gem Caesar salad with steak. It was tasty. This is a solid restaurant. I'm not sure when I'll be in Nashville again, but I'll definitely keep this place in mind!

The food here is good, but the guy who is usually here running the register is not friendly and to be honest, it limits my ability to enjoy the food. Recently, for several months a friendly woman ran the register and my wife and I began to frequent this establishment more often. Today we discovered that the guy is back.... So likely we will decrease our visits again as a result. Maybe we will just do a drive by to see who is running the register. Maybe we will just go elsewhere.

Food was good, but bar service/takeout process needs improvement. The kitchen was pounding orders out and I saw bags & boxes sitting without being delivered for take outs. The gentleman next to me goes 4 nights a week and wasn't even offered water while he sat at the bar waiting to be served; he left and I waited 45 min for my order which was cold by the time I got home. Was disappointing. In their defense, it was a wicked busy night, and, I only went once. There were a bunch of regulars which speaks loudly to their core customers devotion to restaurant.

3.5/5 This was our first time ordering and unfortunately we weren't blown away like the other reviews said we would be. I got the besties 2: chicken and pork with Mac n cheese Hubs got the pulled pork sandwich with beans. We both agreed the best part of the meal was the bbq sauces! That bestie sauce I don't regret trying this while in town, but we preferred pappy's.

Have been there before & really enjoyed it, but this time the sauce was tasty on the boil,but almost completely oil! Also there was a lot of in the shell crawdads. They only have a bite of meat in the tail. Not a very good value for the price. We ordered the Black Pearl. Also, even though we had 4 adults and a 2yo with an 11 yo, only the 4 adults ordered food and the kids ordered drinks, we were automatically billed an 18% tip so our bill came to approx. $228.00. An expensive lunch!
I had the chicken fried steak special. The steak was over cooked and dry. The gravy was bland. The hash browns were old and not hot. All this for 15$. There are better breakfast spots.

Great atmosphere and sat outside on deck. $16 for bread and salad and meal and dessert for that price on lunch menu. Scallops were wonderful. I would not recommend the meatloaf as it was "mushy". Overall great place and good service.
Got a vanilla iced latte with oat milk, a chai tea late, and a caramel brûlée latte. They gave me an extremely small cup for the latte and it was still about $4. The cups were also sticky.

This used to be a pizza place I can count on for whenever I crave for pizza. Sadly this time my experience was subpar. Garlic bread was mostly bread with hints of garlic and the margarita pizza had a burnt base. Everything tasted average at best. Gonna have to hunt for a new place. :(

Let's get right to the point: this place is an ugly twin of Panda Express; it's identical with pricing and food options, but the quality is slightly lower. I think Panda Express is God's gift to mankind, so I thought this place was average. However, I realize any normal person would have probably throw up, and so I am reluctant to give 3 stars, but it's because there can be only one greasy-unauthentic-Asian-running-to-the-bathroom establishment, and that's Panda Express.

Always good food but came in tonight with my family only to be told the dining room was closed. We ate in the car but a sign posted at the door would've been a good idea. Many customers were irritated.

L O C A T I O N ! On recommendation from my daughter who had visited Clearwater Beach, and an old high school friend who lives nearby, we had lunch here. On vacation Minnesota, any seafood was appealing! Crab & Shrimp Chowder. 4 stars Grouper Cheeks. 4 stars Chicken Nachos. 3 stars The Grouper Cheeks were SO DELICIOUS, but I ate too many. Tummy ache, my bad. Chowder, very Floridian. Nachos, near impossible to get from plate to mouth. Our server was a pleasant gal, Julia, but the outstanding feature was the sea view. A little too chilly to have our lunch on the deck, but we were seated by the window. Mesmerizing! Add the guitars with the live music, and a memorable lunch was had. But then the bill arrived, I was astounded by how overpriced it was. Guess that's the amenities price, but all the other restaurants in the area are not that over priced. Just an FYI. O V E R P R I C E D BY A M I L E !

My pizza joint mission is on a roll, visiting places that serve slices and this was on my list. It was around two in the afternoon and it was time to get a couple slices. Counter service like all real pizza joints and I guess because of covid, there was no indoor seating nor outdoors, this was no concern to me. I ordered the two slice deal and sat in the shade by my car. I will say this, the crust was thin crispy and perfectly done. However, I will say this, they use a lower quality cheese and perhaps too much. Yea, I know, too much cheese? With too much low quality cheese I really couldn't get a take on the sauce. My recommendation to the owner would be get a better cheese, use less and it could be a four start pizza. Since this section of 4th Street don't have any other pizza by the slice, please stop in and let me know what you think.

Cool ambiance. Food was OK. I ordered the Sausage Risotto and my husband got the wagyu steak. He commented that he's had better steak for a lot less price. The Risotto was fine but I feel like there are probably better meals on the menu. I'd consider going back and trying something else. The service was kind of slow but it didnt bother me too much because it let me slow down and take in the night. But heed the warning if you have firm plans after dinner; give yourself more time. They have a piano man with table service on the piano. I'd love to do that sometime!

My partner had the Parma Hash which he enjoyed very much. I had the Classic Eggs Benedict which was okay but not great. Was lukewarm, possibly because of the cold tomato that was part of the dish. Service was perfunctory.

Only giving this place a 3 star rating because the manager made up for all the mistakes with mu hubby's meal by comping our whole meal! My husband ordered eggs benedict with the eggs poached hard ( he doesn't like runny yolk ) First order, the eggs were totally runny! Sent it back, the second time, they had very little sauce! So he asked just for some more sauce & they said no we'll have them make it again, took forever! He waited about 45 mins! I was done with mine by the time they got his right! Unacceptable! Will probably not be back! Too bad. We feel like ever since the pandemic, the customer service industry has just gone downhill! They don't care at all

So, went here for me and my boyfriends 1 year anniversary. The atmosphere was beautiful, very inviting. The salad bar was horrible. The food brought to you by waiters was good, the meat was great. But there were no sides....so it was a shitty salad bar with a lot of meat. It was $65 a plate, which honestly I'd rather go to a really fancy restaurant and get a MEAL..not some glorified BBQ. I would suggest replacing the literal potato salad and glazed peanut bar with vegetables, noodles, rice, mashed potatoes, stews. Went for the gimic, won't go back for the food.
The frybread was good but it didn't have any sauce or toppings other than lettuce and cheese which made it rather dry and chewy.

We came here on NYE. Our service was great the waitress was a doll and I had no issues with that. The food is underwhelming and I think over priced. My tenderloin was small and lacked flavor: the pasta course was slimy and the broth was too strong. Salad was good. The crème brûlée which I would've loved to order was ruined by adding ginger. I got blackberry sorbet. Meh. For the cost of the food I would think they could update the interior, it is dated with diff light fixtures and no consistent design or ambience. Same as it was 15 years ago. The other restaurant they own is Acero and that is one of my favorite places. They are very nice here but I'm not rushing back.

We tried this Diner today finally after moving in a few months ago. This place is ALWAYS busy, which to me, means it's mighty tasty. I was greeted over the phone by Meredith, who was sooo nice and friendly! Her customer service was great but unfortunately , the food missed the seasoning mark this morning. I ordered a variety of things: The Apollo omelette, an order of French toast and the corned beef hash breakfast. On the plus side, the French toast was buttery and thick but nothing out of the ordinary. The omelette, grits and hash browns were absent of any type of seasoning (not salt and pepper, but actually seasonings), which was disappointing. I didn't taste any passion!

I've been here at least 50 times and it seems to slowly be going down hill. I'd like to chalk the issues up to being short staffed due to COVID, but it was more than that. The food was lukewarm and slow to come out. If my food i slow then it should at least be hot. Consistently, the service has been lackadaisical, but if you do get lucky enough to sit up stairs that does not seem to be the case.

This place was the old prime bar. It's very spacious and our waitress was very nice. I ordered the Fabio meatball sub with sweet potato fries for lunch. The meal came out fast but my sandwich was luke warm. The meatballs were decent, nothing to get all crazy about like they make it using the chefs name. The sandwich was overall good because the meatballs were spiced nice but a little too soft for me probably from too much filling. My friend got the fish and chips and said it was good.

Wanted to try a new spot during restaurant week and this menu caught my husband and I'd eye. We had a reservation but had to wait a bit outside which was not ideal but fine. Service was quick to start and we were able to put in our order, get our apps and entrees pretty quickly. The food was subpar. I did not like the meatballs at all, I'm not sure what it was but something tastes off. The arancini was okay. Both entrees, chicken parm and short rib ravioli were just okay but lacked flavor. After we were done eating it took about 20 minutes for the waitstaff to finally come and get our plates and bring dessert. I try not to judge restaurants during restaurant week as they are usually very busy but not excuse for bland food. We won't be back.

Although I'm rating this place 3 stars, I did enjoy my dinner here. I think the main draw to this place is its atmosphere and friendly staff. It's not a fancy place but there was a fun New Orleans style band playing and the dance floor was jumping! I found the food to be mediocre. I had the gumbo and the New Orleans BBQ shrimp. Both were just meh. However, the Bread Pudding was fantastic! Best if shared with someone, in fact, it's served with 2 spoons.

Why this place is so popular is beyond me. Tuesday lunchtime it was like a cattle call for this cash-cow business. I ordered a Queen Margherita Pizza that was more like a soft crusted flatbread. For $10.99 I received a portion that was no larger than a slice of $2.99 Pizza. Same goes for the salads, very small portions for lettuce and a few ingredients. That said, the food was decent and enjoyable. It was so busy I was surprised when my order arrived promptly. The poor employees were working like dogs to keep up with the volume of to-go orders, I felt sorry for them. One big plus, actual linen napkins which I appreciated. Worth a try but it will cost you $30 for lunch per couple with tip.

Average food, inattentive bartender, not worth the price. Check out down the road for a better experience if you're solo or with a friend or two. This place is probably for you if you have a bigger group

I had the choriZo and crab tacos and the misses had shrimp and halibut tacos.. the food lacked flavor. The rice was good the salad was meh. Food looks good but the look and taste don't go hand and hand.

The wings came out hot with a rich and tangy sauce that was to die for. My fries were a disappointing, soggy mess, but I would still return. The wings are the highlight here. This place knows what it does well.

Was very excited to have a new coffee place nearby. Ordered a latte. Didn't love my coffee, in fact, I took two sips in the parking lot and didn't finish it. It tasted burnt but not like burnt coffee. It had very little (weak) coffee flavor it just tasted burnt. Will try one more time and update otherwise I'll stick with my other local favorite coffee places. Space is not welcoming. It's not like a cozy cafe where you can sit and read a book while you enjoy your beverage. There's furniture for sale and a one seat hair salon tucked in the corner. However, owners son was a great guy! Very friendly, happy, and kind. He gets 5 for service!
Great pizza! Fun seating where you can see the kitchen. Unfortunately, staff wasn't very friendly. It's also pretty traditional so no ranch(for dipping) or trendy pizzas or cheese bread

You kno. It was OK. Doesn't live up to the 5star hype. I ordered a side chili rellano. It comes enchilada style. Covered w enchilada sauce. I don't like wet rellanos. I'm glad I ordered it dry w sauce on the side. I did not like the enchilada sauce. Also ordered the 2 enchilada plate one chicken one shredded beef. Good basic enchilada but again wasn't impressed w the sauce. The small 2 oz guacamole I ordered was inundated w tomato chunks. Didn't care for that. The chips & salsa was ok. Had to salt them to taste good. Bathroom was clean. Restaurant is clean. Waiter wore mask

I love the food here, but your bottomless system sucks. Bartender shoo'd me away from the bar because I went to inquire after my drink sat empty for over 20 mins. She was rude and the man who was behind the bar already was clearly bothered to follow me to the table to pour my drink. Maybe come up with a better system as this was a very poor experience and not my first time.

Came here for a friend's birthday and was immediately impressed with how clean and modern the interior was. Definitely a bit more upscale than your typical hole in the wall Chinese restaurant. Altogether, 3 of us ordered 5 dishes (including 2 appetizers) : Dan Dan noodles, scallion pancakes, fatty beef sour radish soup, salt and pepper dried squid, and spicy lamb chops. Squid was an easy favorite, but I'm always a sucker for that chewy goodness. I have to give a special shout out to the radish soup. I would order this dish again just for the noodles. They had this almost firm-Jello-like consistency that gave the most perfect bite! And the broth itself was delicious and had a nice spicy kick to it. Wouldn't order the lamb chops again - meat was dry and it didn't go too well with the cumin marinade. A bit on the pricier end, but I think it's appropriate for the vibe and quality of food.

Boba tea has been my latest obsession for the last month. As such, I've been making my rounds at various shops offering my new favorite delicacy. I've noticed most places add a TON of sugar and that's saying a lot coming from me as a dessert connoisseur. I've developed the habit of asking for less sugar as a result so today I ordered a medium milk tea with Oreo bits, less ice, less sugar and boba pearls. I liked the way they cooked their boba as it was softer than others I've had. On the other hand, the tea taste was very strong and I wasn't used to that. It seems they have a different tea to milk ratio than other places I've tried. At any rate, I may go back and try something different, definitely not so bad that I'd write it off. It's also a lot closer to me than other boba spots. One last thing I'll add is their menu is very confusing. It would benefit from some simplification.
It took them 1 hour to serve the food. Just Pho and spring rolls. So for me, that was bad. Food is good

We came in today and had a pretty disappointing experience - we had a reservation, but had to wait an extra 20 minutes to be seated. They seemed a bit short staffed, so we brushed it off, but when our appetizer came, the crudité was covered in strands of someone's hair . Such a bummer.

I had to get a bacon wrapped burrito, cuz.....it's a bacon wrapped burrito! It took awhile to get the burrito, which was fine. The burrito was large and heavy. Unfortunately, it just didn't taste that good, to me anyway. I think I liked the idea of bacon wrapped more than I actually liked the bacon wrapping. I would like to come back and try something else. If you're a big fan of bacon though, this may be the place for you!

Stopped here for lunch at 11:30. Lunch didn't start till noon. Service wasn't that great as the place was slow and the wait staff just hung around....... We left, so I can't give any better then 3 stars. Will try it next time. View is great.

It's a beautiful venue in a Mall higher end group of restaurants. The staff are great and dressed to the part. The pints are cold and the food was decent. The issue hurting The Pub like many places that have beers from other countries ... they are out of a bunch. Not the first Tavern/Pub that I have seen this. I will have to give it another stop in when I am back and see again.

The food is good. We had the truffle fries and the bucatini, which was excellent. But, the alcohol prices are way too high. Macallum 12 is $17, wines are priced too high to order. So if you want to enjoy a drink or maybe two with your dinner, it will cost you.

i had been driving by this place that seemed to appear out of nowhere for quite some time and finally decided to give it a shot. i picked a good time to go because there was no one inside. staff was friendly and took m y order right away. seemed to take a bit longer that i would expect considering i was the only person in the restaurant. i ordered the 15 piece soy garlick boneless wings and fries. not sure if my wings were done before the fries and sat for a few minutes but they werent piping hot like the fries. maybe because the sauce they use was cold or room temp, not sure. in any case, food was decent. the fires were really good. i need to go back to try more of the menu.

Tried Mi Hacienda this weekend after seeing great reviews about it! I ordered Enchiladas Rojas with a Texas Margarita and my boyfriend got the Texaco Burrito(I think that's what it was called). Our waiter was very informative and shared his favorite dish on the menu. Everything tasted great, but I am rating average compared to other places. Would definitely go back for the quick service!! Yes we devoured the queso in the pic below :-)

1st of all, the service was phenomenal. Our waitress was fantastic. That's about it. Everything was way overcooked, the scallops were the consistency of chicken. Shrimp was shoe leather. Don't order the filet, order a sirloin, because that's what you're gonna get if you order a filet. The spinach tasted extremely fishy, which was weird..... The lamb was overcooked to the point of being inedible. Everything was ordered medium rare, and was cooked beyond well done. The garlic ranch dressing..... no garlic, extra sugar! Blech! But, it's extremely affordable, so what do you expect? Atmosphere was nice, and the service was good. We didn't complain, but they could tell we weren't happy and still comped the scallops, and desert. Again, the service was great..

This is an enjoyable breakfast spot, but I likely will not return often. Just generally speaking, I felt the food was a bit pricey - although I did enjoy the meal I had. The parking is also very sparse and hard to come by. Overall, if you eat here - you will enjoy your meal. The experience might not be up to standards, though

Oh Martha why :( the food is still delish but these price raises are so rude. Ex) $10 for the sunflower hummus when it was $9 last week...hummus was $6 in June folks. It's like we've jumped years into the future with this inflation. I understand there's been an ownership change but it hurts. I used to bring people here bragging about my fav restaurant & the reasonable prices, how they made me feel at home -like I too w my measly salary could join in on the fun. Additionally, what was so unique about the place were the rotating specials & appetizers (also reasonably priced) & they *just* added new specials after months. Martha was so cool, now like every other yuppy joint. *rant*

The last 2 times we were at Doc Fords has been disappointing. I realize with Covid staffing could be an issue but don't accept reservations then. Three days ago I made reservations for lunch for 4 today. I said we'd like to be outside, ground level because we will be bringing two dogs. We arrived right on time and we were told to wait for a text. We waited 10 minutes then I was notified our table was ready. The hostess took us to a patio table. I said we have two dogs, she said oh I'll have to talk to the Mgr about you sitting with dogs on the patio.. I said we want to sit ground level, I mentioned that when I made my reservations. She seemed frustrated with me and told me to wait. She never came back. Meanwhile I had my husband go inside to the hostess desk to see what he could do. They finally sat us outside, ground level. Our server was not friendly at all, the food was marginal at best. A very disappointing experience.

I've been a customers of P. J. Whelihan's for many years. There have been good experiences and not so good ones. Last night was a good one. Our server was quick and efficient. I had a speciality drink which was delicious. Cupid's kiss. I took a photo of it so I can continue to order it in the future. The wings were crispy last night with just the right amount of sauce. I love the Buffalo chicken salad with hot wing nuggets. It's one of the better Buffalo salads in the area. The pj fries are always a hit with the warm cheese sauce.

Place looks amazing. We were excited to eat here on NYE and made a 8:00 reservation through Open Table for our party of 8. We showed up at 6:30 because we were hungry and wanted to eat earlier. Place was empty. Hostess says they had staff issues and only had pizzas available. We left because some of our party wanted the pasta. My only reason for posting is I never got an alert saying they had a limited menu. A heads up would have been nice on NYE. We made a reservation so we wouldn't have to search all over for a place which is what ended up happening.

I was pretty disappointed by this place. Based on reviews, I expected that nice trendy foodie stuff. Unfortunately it was mediocre. Decent food. The Mac was the best part of it. The chicken for chicken and waffles was weird and had some gooey discoloration inside. We opted not to eat it. The waffle was meh. The maple bacon Brussels sprouts were undercooked and swimming in watery syrup. Would only come here again because the mac n cheese was a nice hefty portion and really creamy (the way I like it).

Over priced gnocchi dish. Very small portion, barely covered the small pasta bowl it was in. There was maybe 15 very small gnocchI. For $ 23.00 no side dish, bread or salad included. Also the other dish we got was the steak with large beans. Steak was average beans were hard again over priced $30.00

Service was great! Atmosphere was good, we ordered the crab cakes to start and they were really good! For our entrees we ordered the Taste of New Orleans, which came out almost cold, like yesterdays food reheated in a microwave. Did not taste fresh at all. We also had the blackened Bayou Duck, which was good nothing over the top spectacular but good. It came with a side of jambalaya that was also cold and not fresh. Overall it was an okay spot, but we wouldn't visit again.

Ordered through DoorDash. It was quickly ready and delivered. We ordered a Sierra Mist but received a Pepsi, assume they were out. No sauce came with the garlic parm breadsticks. They were mostly dry and unlike what I expected. Pizza was overall good.

The food and service is always great. My number one complaint is the drive through. The line is always long and hangs out into traffic. I know that's not DD's fault for such a crappy road to be on and people are sooooo impatient. But I'm happy to get my sweet tea at DD!

I was underwhelmed with my meal. I ordered the chicken fried chicken. The portion was quite small with barely any chicken and tasteless, and the stuffing was very dry. The waitress was very nice and attentive.

I typically receive good food/service when I've visited LongHorn in the past and this day I didn't think I'd have any issues. We were greeted and immediately seated and our server Sarah soon came over to greet us and take our drink orders. She was very patient, attentive, and friendly. Ordered were placed, received our bread, then appetizers and then our meal. I asked for my steak to be medium well and instead received a very well done steak. So much so that the other side of the steak (part that was plate down) was burnt and the part that was plate up was burnt as well but not that bad. I was eating charred meat. Informed our server who was very apologetic and said I could send it back (something I don't like to do at all and didn't). She took my plate and soon returned and said she took my entire meal off the bill. I was thankful for her support and made sure she got a lil extra tip on top of the 20%. Everything else with our meal was good and tasty. Oh the one thing I didn't care for was the French Onion soup. The cheese on top was super chewy. So much so that I thought I had gum in my mouth.

Pizza here is OK. Nothing special but fills you up. But never order pizza here on Grubhub. You might get it the next day. For the second time, big delay after ordering pizza, last night so much that when I called--an hour + later, they hadn't even started the order (even tho the GH app said driver would be there in 10 min. When I asked to cancel they said I would have to go thru Grubhub to do that. And not a hint of an apology. This is a challenging time for restaurants, I get it, but if so, possibly they should stop taking orders thru GH or DD if they can't be sent out in a reasonable time frame.

Hate to say it but I don't understand what all of the hype is about! Was expecting long lines and crowds but ended up getting a table in the back room in the apartment complex lobby. Tried to order online with the QR code but it kept giving me an error that items in my cart were no longer available, but not specifying which items, so I ended up waiting in line to order anyway. No one in my group liked the grilled cheese Jerusalem bagel. One compared it to frozen Ellio's pizza- and they weren't wrong- yikes. The avocado kubaneh toast was good, but nothing special beyond your average avocado toast. The pistachio sticky bun was by far the stand out item, but definitely doesn't compare to the pastries at Suraya. I don't drink coffee but others in the group strongly disliked theirs. My Bloody Mary was horrible, one of the worst I've had. The items were delivered to the table sporadically with huge gaps of time in between. For example, we ordered 2 sticky buns and one came out right away and the other came out after we finished everything and were packing up to leave. Overall, a big ol' disappointment.

We have been to several glory days grills around the area. This is our first visit to this one located on route 54. We ordered the slam dunk pretzels and while the cheese sauce was very good the pretzels had an older tasting oil on them and we did not finish them. We also ordered eight wings with honey barbecue which were fine and a chicken tender platter which was very good. Service was average. As for the location itself, We were surprised that it was not more busy on Saturday. I have a feeling there's a reason that is now I'm not sure why. All in all not a bad location but certainly not the best either.
Friendly service The food is fine (but not super ) Price is pretty affordable You have to find a parking space in the street ( no private parking lot)

Seemed like a really cool place so we had to check it out; Housed in an old church, we were hoping for some heavenly delicious food but were disappointed that it wasn't quite out of the world. The entrance is a bit weird where there's a small foyer with a step that blocks the view to the rest of the place so you could be standing in there and unless the maitre'd is at their podium they can't see you. They seemed understaffed with the server also acting as a hostess. Started with the crawfish hushpuppies, which had a nice sauce with it; they were a bit salty but the pickled red onion and sauce helped to balance them. I got the market fish, which honestly I was pretty disappointed about. There was was too much lentils with it, and the fish was overseasoned and very salty. The salad on top was nice to help freshen up the fish but it needed more, and I only ate about 1/2 of the lentils; they ironically didn't taste like much.

Came here in a hurry to grab something to eat. Unfortunately they were severely understaffed with only two waiters to serve a holiday rush of customers. We had to seat ourselves and our table with still dirty. Our waiter was extremely apologetic and lovely despite the stress he was under. The food though- not the best. Crab cakes were overly salted, dry, and not as good as others I've had. Hollandaise sauce was not hollandaise but more like melted cheese. Grits were sooo bland I had to add numerous condiments. I tried a few things from my friend's plates including their omelettes, which were also bland. Truthfully, I would give this place 2 stars if it wasn't for our great waiter and the cheap prices. 2 for 1 mimosas was also a steal.

This place has such a fun vibe! Some friends and I stopped in here for lunch and drinks, and got in right before the lunch rush. Our entrees included Gumbo, Crawfish Pie, and Shrimp PoBoys; all 3 were great. Pictured below is the gumbo. If you're in the mood to drink, this place serves a delicious Hurricane. It certainly checked all the boxes! This place is definitely a fun spot to come and enjoy some good eats and beverages at!

It wasn't what I expected I might go back if someone asked or wanted to meet here it was good though. The place wasn't what I expected I'm always used to seeing a lot of decoration indoor and stuff like that when I looked it upIt looked very different than when I arrived. We went inside it was really packed.Will they get a nice spot though it wasn't close to the doors that's what made it nice but right next to the bathrooms. We are happy to see the food, it was so good and we wanted to get the beef shank but they ran out. I think I might go back if someone recommended or was close today at one to go to the meet up and eat. Food was delicious I wait or even brought us some of the food that was sold out that's customer service.

So we have been going to this place a couple years now. I first fell in love with the fried pork egg rolls they are my favorite in town still! The brisket is cooked well but the broth is sweeter then I like . I'm having a hard time justifying $15.50 for a bowl of pho I first loved pho because it was economical but this place has changed with all the upgrades they want to increase prices. Maybe we only go on slow days but I never see many others in there maybe they have caught on too. The prices went up twice the last few times I've been there. Since I can get pretty decent pho elsewhere I can no longer justify the prices . Service is good. Food was excellent prices are more than they should be for this area and because there is competition near by. Thanks for the good food and good luck!

The food was very good and our waitress was kind. However i'm pretty sure my entire family has food poisoning from this place. My husband has uncontrollable bowel movements and my daughter and I both have awful stomach aches. I feel like my appendix has exploded. Please be cautious when you go here. Not to mention when they messed up my son's order, they were very rude about remaking it even though i paid $8 for a bag of fritos with some beef in it. I'm sure it was not difficult to make.

Service is friendly but definitely not fast. A very casual pace at this restaurant. There were only two other people dining, or should I say waiting for their food, in the restaurant but still service was extremely slow. My flight was leaving out of gate A-17 right next door so I was prepared to leave without food if my flight boarded before my food was ready. The menu is rather limited and they were out of some things. I ordered a grilled cheese and pickle chips after they were out of my first choice. The server kept me updated on the status of my order, which I appreciated. Food is good but definitely not a place to eat if you don't have extra time. The atmosphere here is slow and casual which isn't as good fit for an airport restaurant. I took my food to go and the server brought it out just seconds before I had to board, so it worked out. My grilled cheese was burned but the fries were good. Probably won't attempt to dine here again unless I have time to spare.
The food was good they could have toasted the Buns the music videos amazing Tevin Campbell Jodeci Boyz II Men

so, I expect my fish and chips to be greasy, but this took it to a level I've never seen before. they have managed to transform a potato into a sponge... what has science done? not really my thing but I'm sure someone loves it. breading was kind of dull and outside is very lightly salted. I'd eat here again but probably wouldn't get the potatoes

I came here originally in 2014 and had the best chicken sandwhich ever. It's no longer on the menu so I tried something new, the bru burger. Your standard bacon cheeseburger. It was the day before the CFP championship game so It was packed so that's find. We got seated fairly quickly and ordered food and drinks. Our food eventually came. My burger was room temperature. Cheese was congealed. Bottom of the bag lettuce, bun was room temp. I sent the burger back, a dream hour and fries came out about 10 minutes later. The burger was hot, not warm but hot. However, It lacked any type of flavor. It was obviously a pre made/frozen patty. All of our burgers were the same size, temperature (despite ordered different) and same grill marks. It's hard to think of a place claiming gourmet burgers serving pre made Patties. I took about 3 bites and It never got vetted. I'm giving 3 stars because the wait staff was awesome and the peach white chelate bread pudding was amazing!

After dining here I remember why I stopped going. The appetizer was really good and it was crab stuffed shrimp Rangoon. I liked those a lot. The salad was Just ok. I had a Cesar and they were several wilted and brown leaves. But minus those it tasted OK. I also had create your own feast and had the bay scallops oven fried and salmon grilled with mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes and the salmon were good but the scallops did not taste great and were tiny ones which it did not mention on the menu. Overall it was OK but for the price it wasn't worth it. The waiter was really good and very attentive. He made the experience better.

In town looking for a hot ramen place for dinner because of a rainy day. Only 2 places opened due to holiday week. Sachi offered more menu selection so we picked this place over the other ramen place. Both ramen are served very hot so it's a good choice of hot food in a rainy day.

Three stars is generous for our experience and I'm mostly putting that because it is a pleasant, lively environment, the waitress was nice and they had Zombie Dust on tap. The service was slow because she had too many tables. Would not return for the food. Had the spinach and artichoke dip: few artichokes, practically no discernible spinach, very heavy mayonnaise texture and inadequate quantity of chips which oddly were dusted in chili powder. The nut and fruit salad had no nuts. My salad greens were not at all fresh, so I spent the meal picking slimy bits out and setting them to the side. Hubby had "no complaints" about the tenderloin sandwich. Cucumbers in the coleslaw was a pleasant surprise.

Staff very friendly we were greeted quickly the place is very clean and well appointed with tables and booths, outdoor seating is available. I went there for the Meatball Burrito I saw them detail on the news one day it looked appealing however I was disappointed with the taste ( like canned spag sauce) very little meatballs. Was it okay yes -just okay would I order again no. Salad we had a power bowl salad with Chicken that was awesome. If in a hurry good place to go but I would not go out of my way eat there.

Good little spot! It's a little dingy but that seems to be the norm for the area. Service isn't great, but hey, they brought the food! The butter chicken was good. They do more of a shredded chicken style as opposed to chunks but the sauce was delicious. That's my sons go to and he rather enjoyed it. The goat vindaloo was a bit bland but and didn't have any potatoes but was still decent. I loved the nana and only wish it was hot and that it came out before we were halfway through our meal. It was fluffy in the edges and crispy on the bottom with great seasoning. The vegetable samosa was probably some of the best I've had and recommend trying that to start you'd meal.

Upon my arrival I was not greeted at all. They had 2 ladies standing in the back of the restaurant just looking at everyone coming in. Never said a word to be and another lady that walked in. Then 2 more ladies came from the back kitchen and didn't otter a word neither. Never said someone is gonna be with you, how can I help you? NOTHING! As if I wasn't even standing there. The young that handle takeout orders finally arrived and didn't say she was sorry for my wait. Now on to the food. The wing was very bland, and tough. They had VERY little flavor at at. I don't know what the toughest was about. But they were hard to chew and pull. I don't now if they were under cooked or what. The onion rings were on the burnt side. It's been awhile since I've been to this particular location and now I see why. Because it will be awhile before I return again

The restaurant was pretty empty, and We were immediately seated upon arrival. Our server was nice and personable. We started with the fried biscuits and they were hot and delicious. The service (food prep) was slow. I ordered the meat lovers skillet with French toast. The skillet was delicious, but Almost cold. The French toast was just awful. I hope that it was just a bad day, because I should've asked for a refund. The French toast tasted like cooked bread, without any flavor. I had my husband take a taste as well, and he was shocked and felt the same way . My husband ordered the same (meat lovers) skillet but with scrambled eggs, and pancakes. He wasn't a fan of the pancakes, but enjoyed the skillet. Overall, I'd try this out place again, just for the fried biscuits and possibly the skillet. Again, we had a very friendly server! 5 stars for the server!

Went here for dinner while on vacation in Santa Barbara, and loved the location but did not love the experience as much. The table we were seated at had crumbs all over each chair. We had to ask our waiter for utensils twice while our appetizers got cold. They no longer serve lobster but it's still on the menu. They were also out of two other types of fish entrees. The peppered red snapper was pretty good, however it came with an overwhelming amount of potatoes. The Gamelli pasta was a simple yet good choice. The octopus was a very good appetizer with great sauce.

Went here on Christmas Day for some good chow. DONT COME HERE ON CHRISTMAS. waited 2 hours for mediocre at best food when they told me the wait was 20-40 minutes. Food was ok but was not even worth the 20-40 minutes much less the 2 hours. They were disorganized and they lied about the wait time over the phone and in person. They had no organization as to the order in which the food was made.

Dined here by myself last night and it was Ok, but not great. The front of the restaurant is piled up with used boxes and tables with chairs piled up on them, such that I wasn't sure if it was open or open just for take out. When I peeked around the corner I could see that there were about a dozen tables and just one was occupied. Perhaps the owners should clean up the place and take a little pride of ownership. I ordered a side salad and a bowl of #12 Pho. The salad consisted of iceberg lettuce, and iceberg lettuce. Nothing else. I don't believe there was any dressing on it either but if there was it had no taste. As for the Pho, was somewhat tasty but it was served to me just barely lukewarm, not hot as I would expect a hearty soup with noodles to be served. I sent it back and ask them to please warm it up for a few minutes. Now...I am an experienced Vietnamese food eater, (which is why I chose this restaurant), but I have to say I was somewhat disappointed. My experience here was subject to the fact that I was very hungry having spent the day traveling from the East Coast. The service was average--they seemed overwhelmed filling take-out orders. Would I go back? Hmmmm. I'll keep searching.

The service was good, the prices are reasonable, but the food was just so-so. I'd order the enchiladas again, but the rice was dry. My companions ordered the chimichanga and burrito grande. The burrito grade was, well, grande! Massive. But he said it was delicious, and he'd definitely order it again. The chips were good, but the salsa was just "eh". We like spicy. The spicier the better, and this was just typical, restaurant-grade. Nothing to write home about.

Good food with a lousy service! We dined outside due to COVID reasons. Once seated it took 20 mins to just get water, the restaurant wasn't even at 50% capacity. The waitress was like I don't care. We asked a question about kids menu which she said I will check with the chef, guess what? 20 more mins without any reply with the same waitress serving other tables. We ordered chorisso stuffed chicken, truffled gnocchi and saffron salmon, all were quite good. Giving a 3 star for the good food but lousy service.

The bakery is excellent, however the debit swipe machines prompt for gratuity. I did not tip and got attitude from girl up front. Sorry, but you were just packing one lemon bar to go. Get over yourself.

Decent dining experience with outrageous prices. We tried a variety of items. Some were excellent like the bib lettuce, the bone marrow and the blue crab dumplings. The skirt steak and the duck breast arrived cold, so perhaps they could have been more impressive had they been served at the right temperature. The hot pot was good, but it was a very small portion. Desserts and drinks were just ok. Wine list was lacking good mid price range bottles.

Uh oh! What happened Pia's? Once upon a time you were amazing. Loved your place. Yet I think someone in the kitchen now owns stock in a salt company. I was not able to eat my entree due to way too much salt. This too much salt thing has been going on for a few weeks. Once it gets fixed I'd like to return. Sweet waitress. Cute place.
This location on Virginia and Neil rd is closed pile of boxes kitchen and dining room lights are turned off

I pass this place all the time and I decided to give it a try today, bad idea, I walked in and had to stand there for a few min because the sign says to wait to be seated, there were only 2 tables being occupied, and one waitress that needs a class in customer service, she acted like she had an attitude when she seated me,. I decided what I wanted to eat and had to sit there another 10-15 min before she came and took my order, she brings me my food, but I had no silverware, so I had to wait till she brought my silverware, the food was horrible I have never seen egg drip soup so thick and disgusting, it literally looked like snot with peas in it, the rice was tasteless, and the sweet and sour chicken had no taste. So needless to say I left just as hungry as I did when I walked in. I will never patronize Sky Dragon ever again.

Amazing food every time. The only thing is I wish they would enforce social distancing again because it sucks to have someone cough on you mid pandemic trying to wait for your cheesesteak. Ordering system is great and cash only so be prepared.

Not sure why all the bad reviews. We've been ordering take out from here weekly for nearly four years and have few to no complaints. The pizza is consistently fresh, hot, and good. From time to time we also get the boneless wings and found them to be tasty. We order online, and the pizza is always ready by the time we reach the store. This locations has a pick up window and u can pay on line so make it extremely awesome and save specially during the pandemic before vaccines. is important to mention the people at the pick up window re always super nice never have any problems, no attitude and no drama. Has there been some mess ups? Of course. A couple of pizzas came out undercooked, or they get an order wrong. These are a rarity given the frequency of our orders but a quick call to the manager and they fix the problem right away either with re-macking the pizza or giving a credit for next order. The important thing is they have always made it right. Not everyone like Pizza Hut pizza, but that's a personal preference. for us this location is and always be our Pizza Friday and yes we obviously like it! I'm giving 4 stars because there is always improve so when the time comes will give the 5 star.

I go to the eegees on st marys maybe twice a week or so. They're great there. The employees are friendly. The food is almost always on point. But there have been a few times where they've messed it up- but when I go back they fix it with a smile. Their fries are always made to order so they're always fresh. I just wish they'd even out their fizz drinks, about half the time you only get like a squirt of soda. And it would be cool if they had more flavors of their slushees. But the restaurant is super clean, as well as the bathrooms, you can see right into the kitchen and see it's just as clean- all their employees wear masks too.

I've been here about 10 times. Every single time I've been here the staff seems to be upset with my presence. No matter who I'm with or how I am. Every time since day one. Even the waitresses that are completely fake nice, you can tell they are secretly plotting your death. Food is pretty good although a bit overpriced in my opinion. Atmosphere is all right. Beer- eh. Pretty loud in there too. like they could use some sound baffling. Props on having shuffle board and pool. My least favorite part of this place is the stuffed bear. Not because of animal rights or anything but because it's completely in the way and I bump into it every time I go to the bathroom. Pretty gross cause I'm sure everyone else does it too. Covid super spreader right there. All this being said I'll probably definitely go back. But maybe in a few months.

I'm from ND but my friend that lives here said we had go here for supper cause it was so good, she was not wrong!! My food was so amazing (I got something with Bolognese) and she loved hers too (chicken Marsala)! The only problems I had was it was pretty cramped in there and our waiter was in such a hurry it kind of gave us anxiety! Would recommend though!!

2nd visit. First was a Yelp sponsored event. The $5.00 (small pitcher) before 5 is a definite pull for me. I tried the tomato soup this visit. Very good. Not like the milk based I grew up with back east. More of a Mediterranean style which I now prefer. Was not aware you can order individual board items, $4 ea, we ordered artichoke toast great, and second time ordering the Tuna sandwich w chips. My only criticism is the same Tuna w chips we ordered at the Yelp event was "stuffed " w tuna and piled high w chips. Not so today. Lots of bread and few chips to share. Likely to return for $5 before 5 and homemade soups.

This is a new Burmese/Thai/sushi restaurant on Northside of town across from North Central high-school. Cute little restaurant, clean, very atune service. Food was good. Got fried spring rolls, steamed chicken dumplings, pad ka prao minced chicken, and Burmese curry noodle soup. The soup was certainly the highlight of the meal. Very similar ingredients to a kao soi but no crunchy rice noodles and a thinner, "soupier" broth. Reminded me of consistency of a Tom kha soup. It was exceptional. The pad ka prao is sliced meat here but they made it thai style by request by mincing meat. The entree comes with side of jasmine rice topped with fried egg. The stir fry was good, not overly sweet or overly basil flavored. It is in the middle of pack as far as this particular dish goes around indy metro. The spring rolls and dumplings were both fair as well. Definitely will be back to try more entrees, menu items to gather better opinion. Great to have another thai spot in metro.

Good late night stop. Clean and efficient, we got a couple rolls, they weren't the best but def ok for the convenience of location. Kinda pricey, but again, very convenient. I think they have karaoke some nights as well

Very beautiful restaurant. It's pretty much an upscale pho restaurant. The pho was actually pretty good for a suburban area. A great place to get pho if you don't want to drive to Philly and deal with the vaccine mandate or just don't want to go to Philly in general. Probably the best authentic pho I had outside of Philly. They're generous with their meats and noodles. The broth was a little lacking to me but nothing a little bit of fish sauce and hoisin/sriracha couldn't fix. I would also recommend their summer rolls. It was so fresh and now those were the best summer rolls I've ever had. I would definitely come back for them! I didn't try their Japanese cuisine but it was pretty much just sushi. A little bit on the pricey side but they have uni and toro! Now that's legit. Try them out if you like pho and sushi
Always fresh and homemade items on the menu daily reminds you of that home cook meal your mom would make!

Not bad for a sports bar. It's loud in here but that's warranted. The food was pretty good can't even front. I wasn't expecting it to be honestly but it was! Hubby got a burger and I got a chicken sandwich. We got wings for starters. He also got some chili, which he said was awesome. Didn't get to take pics of the wings cuz we gobbled them up before I thought about my camera lol will definitely be back to grab some beers and possibly watch a game :)

The food here is excellent. Food is priced well. The Eggs Benedict and the Kitchen Sink were incredible. I enjoyed the food so much here and well-cooked. The food was fantastic but has a small portion. I highly recommend this place and will continue to go back.

While there is no doubt this is some of the best pizza in town, the lines and the wait are brutal. I have ordered from here three times and every time it took 30/40 minutes longer than I was told over the phone.

holy moly the raviolis taste like fingerolis. CORRECTION: in case it wasn't clear Yelp HQ I did NOT enjoy my ravioli at the Olive Garden in Willow Grove and the only saving grace of the experience was the fact that they DID taste like fingers :)

I've been trying to make my way here since I first saw the king cake beignet on Instagram. I'm happy this place did not disappoint. It was very busy and we barely found a seat. Please keep in mind there is no wait staff. You have to order at the bar. I had the panini which came with truffle fries. The prosciutto had a strong taste which I personally did not care for but if you like prosciutto I'm sure this sandwich would work you. The truffle fries were delicious. I ate them all and they were cold! The king cake beignet had the traditional beignet dough flavor with a sweet glaze. The filling tasted of cream cheese and walnuts. I tried the queso and was surprised it tasted so freshly made. The flatbread was amazing. I'll get it next time I go. I also want to try the beignet flight. This place would make for a cute date.
The place is nice, The servers treat you so kindly, I felt like I was a queen that's how nice they are. All in all, this is a good waffle house!

Only been for takeout a handful of times but the good is always hot and fresh. Chicken is cooked well and dish is packed with flavor. Only warning is the food is quite spicy so if you don't have a high spice tolerance just opt for medium or mild.

We really liked this place. You choose which seafood to have steamed in a bag, and what kinds of sauces. It can be pricey if you choose lobster or king crab, but you can keep the cost down with cheaper but yummy options. We had fun and will go back. The Cajun spice was good. I will probably just do garlic sauce next time. I'm allergic to shrimp and was happy that I didn't have a reaction when I just ordered clams and muscles. Over all, it's fun to put on a bib and get buttery with your food:)

This cafe was okay. Their cheese grits were great. The breakfast sandwich and boudin omelette were meh. I'd only eat there again if it was the only place we could get into (which is why we ate there the first time). Service was good!

My fiancé and I dined here for a date night. The atmosphere is very neat. It is a bit rambunctious due to the kitchen being open, but it creates a very unique dining experience and ambiance for diners. We ordered a vodka lemon martini, which was excellent. For dinner, we ordered Caesar salad, which was a perfect compliment to my ribeye, and my fiancé's chicken Parmesan. My ribeye was ordered medium rare, and cooked to the correct temperature. It did lack flavor, but it was a solid steak--nothing too excellent but satisfying. My fiancés chicken parm was excellent, unfortunately it was probably better than my steak, but a knockout for the menu for sure! Service was sufficient, but not excellent due to them being busy, totally understandable. This is a solid restaurant if in the area.

Solid Tex-Mex food. Decent prices. Saved us during a stint at the beginning of May 2020. Definitely order the Wet Burritos here. Quite good. I'm not a huge burrito fan, but dang these were stick to your ribs good (and so filling my husband couldn't even finish it).

My go to spot when I am craving Poke. The atmosphere is nice and clean and the workers are very fun and energetic. I love the variety and amount of options they provide as well as their expansive Hawaiian inspired menu. The portions are just right and the flavors are amazing. One downside is depending on when you go in the fish isn't always fresh, but this is a somewhat rare occurence.

We rolled into Clearwater in bumper-to-bumper traffic on the weekend of the outback bowl! Tons of Razorbacks and Nittany Lions everywhere in the street and on the beach it was great to see the crowds enjoying the beautiful Florida weather. This location of the clear sky has been a favorite of ours for years because it's steps away from the public access to the beach. After a nice long walk on the beach my husband and I slipped into a beautiful table outside just in time for the happy hour half-price drinks who doesn't love it! We ordered fried grouper bites excellent, as well goat cheese portobello mushroom flatbread a little bit more of a cracker and too crispy for me wouldn't get it next time but very tasty. My husband had the grill triggerfish sandwich which was delicious and of course you know you just need a few extra things so we took home a burger that's a crowdpleaser all the time. Service is great outdoor people watching excellent and the food is is good. Live music Sunday - steel drum solo man with great rhythm and a great singing voice. Happy hour half price drinks only Monday thru Friday but $2 off on Sunday! The restaurant has eco friendly straws if you must use one.

This fun shop had good seating, live music on a Saturday, and great cappuccino. Would have easily given 5 stars if we had been acknowledged by the barista, been asked to wait as he was obviously short staffed or maybe even received a smile. I would go back because I like the name, but the coffee is good too.

Nice vibe and good food, service was fast. I was having Creole food for first time, while it was good, it will not be on top of my list. Expect to be surprised by the taste. The portions are small so pls order side dishes and appetizers. Good tropical daiquiris which are a must.
The food was absolutely delicious. The only bummer was finding out the injera is made from only part teff flour, because im gluten free

Overall good food. The pizza was good, had a homemade taste and the wings are great. The garlic bread was burnt and terrible though and we weren't refunded for it, but the waitress and staff was friendly.

I've been coming to this quaint little restaurant in Safety Harbor for over 10 years. Another "go to" place for me. Great menu variety - definitely something for everyone, tots of beers on tap and great service. I always go for the Fried Green Tomatoes - just delicious. It's usually my spot for a light lunch of assorted appetizers after a long walk between parks. Mostly all outdoor seating- open air - sun and shade it's a great place to unwind and take in the relaxing vibes of Safety Harbor!

A cute little space in the CBD. Outdoor seating was available, and looked very nice, but it was too cold to sit outside. Service was right on top of our needs, making sure our drinks and water never were empty. Appetizers (shareables) were good portion sized, the meals were very good.
LOVE the pesto, always hits the spot for pasta cravings when in SB! Quick, easy, and cheap. Love you presto!

This place is always very consistent with their food and the service. The location is great...(a few steps outside the Quarter.) We started with the tuna tataki, then had some rolls and split everything. We were very happy with the food selections that we made. We will go back again soon.

Was looking for somewhere close to work to get food from. Delivery here through DoorDash was going to be $23 just for a $12 burger so I decided to just go get it. Aside from the gluten free bread tasting like a sponge, everything was fine;
went to the bar and got the garden of greens drink with rum. very yummy, only taking away one star because it was $12. i like the atmosphere here and the bartender was very friendly!

Reluctantly tried this today, despite the rating. The gentleman that was serving was in on the ball and friendly. (Hard to find in today's labor pool.). Service was quick for only having one person serving. I did the triple entree, and was pleasantly surprised. The orange sesame chicken was cooked perfectly and delicious. Green beans were crisp and well seasoned. I tried the spicy potatoes, which were delicious. My only reason for the 4-star rating was the potatoes. Had they been cooked a little softer to be able to cut wit plastic ware or maybe just cubed or even cut to half the size for easier eating, that would have pushed the 5th star. Glad I stopped here for lunch while in the mall.

If you've ever enjoyed Paradise bakery (rip), this is absolutely the place to go. Their tomato soup is AMAZING. I go here just for the soup! Outside of that, their customer service is good. They have fantastic soups & salads and everything comes with a cute little croissant. Try this place out!
Very good, quick service, amazing food. Chips and salsa were literally the best I've had anywhere. Would recommend. Just wish they had frozen margs, hopefully they add that.

I was down for the count, and had been making my rounds getting different kinds of soup.. it was Pho's turn... I actually thought this was the place I normally go to but apparently it was not... I was not at all disappointed tho... I got the brisket & ribeye pho and it was delicious... the broth is every so slightly sweet but also peppery it was right on point with what I needed in the moment. I thoroughly enjoyed it and can see why the reviews are all positive. I now have an additional place to get great Pho... I'm looking forward to trying other menu items.

Not bad. We had the Cuban pollo platter which was very tasty. The chicken breast was small and dry but the flavor- just the right amount and combo of spices - was good. The beans and rice were excellent and the maduros were absolutely addicting. It gets a minus one star for uncomfortable seating inside and out; and dirty tables and floors.

Food was very good and the view was fantastic. We sat outside for the kite festival and enjoyed ourselves. Our waiters name was Devon who was very friendly and attentive. They have valet parking and let us keep our car beyond the 2 hour request. I am not giving this 5 stars because of the front reception staff. We weee told we didn't need a reservation for lunch to just come back to the desk to be seated (we had 45 minutes till lunch service). When we did my husband was greeted by a rude young man who said they weren't seated. My husband explained and ultimately requested the manager who was pleasant and seated us. Overall good experience except for the hic

Great outside dining area. We were there on a Sunday for a Sunday brunch which their brunch menu is somewhat limited. The food was good. I had the Salmon bowl and the salmon was cooked perfectly. My wife did have the bottomless Mimosas. Prices are reasonable.

I love going to this place, the views are pretty awesome. The food is good, especially the blue cheese chips are so amazing. Also the sweet tea is the best sweet tea I've ever had. The service was actually pretty good for us each time we went. I tried before the boneless wings and the cheese burger, they were both pretty mediocre. However I'd still keep going back.

Some of the best Jamaican food out here and trust me when I say that's a HARD find. My go to is stew chicken all the time but TODAY?! Something about todays plate that had every one attempting to violate my "get six feet" order. It was BUSSIN BUSSIN! And the price ain't too shabby for the amount to get! Of course ima order again duhhhh! Lol
Our server Sarah was amazing! We had oysters on half shell, hush puppies, grouper bites. All was very good. Fun and casual atmosphere with TVs!

Was seated by the door- not my fancy, so I asked to move. It was no problem!! My server asked all the right questions that fit with my group dynamic - checked on my at least four times during the meal - he was just "all over it" with all his guests - He had the Perfect disposition for his job! I ordered the regular ribeye but asked to have it fire grilled. It was cooked just as I like it - med rare and was just delicious. I added mushrooms and onions , which I love and they were also cooked well. Sides were cooked perfectly - sweet potato and garlic butter asparagus It was an overall really good experience.

The food quality was a-1 as far as the meats Very good The pancake was the best one i had here in stlouis. I am an experienced kbbq eater and the server was treating me as if it was my first time not bringing out any lettuce , jalapeños , garlic and what not. The portions wasn't as much as i thought honestly should of gotten the large

We were able to make reservations for New Years Eve which was such a nice treat since most big events in the city were cancelled. The staff was very welcoming and seated us about 10 minutes after our reservation time (not bad considering it was very busy!) Our order was taken quickly and the server took care of our wine (no corking fee...bonus!) Our four course meal was up charged to $85pp because of the holiday. It took a while to get each course, however I believe it was because the restaurant was rather busy. The burrata was good, not great. It had a caprese style to it, so maybe my personal preference but I didn't love. The gnocci was good, not great. A little too oily for my preference. My third course was another pasta option which was good but not bursting with flavor. When it came time for dessert, it had been over two hours since we started to eat so we decided to take it home. I got the lemon blueberry oil cake and it was delicious! Overall our experience was good not great. I think the $85pp up charge was a bit of a turnoff, however it was NYE so that is to be expected. The food wasn't amazing but it was still good! Our servers and staff were all wonderful and the ambiance of the restaurant was very cute! Would I go back? Maybe! Just not for an $85 pre fixe meal.
Vibe is amazing. Not a long wait time. Food was great but wish there was a larger list of options on menu.

Pretty decent. I want to give only 3 stars but something more like 3 and half would be more appropriate. The food has potential to be so delicious but I'm not sure if we came on an off day but everything was kind of lacking flavor. The mimosas were okay. I think I just personally prefer OJ.
