The beni could've been good if the asparagus was cook a bit more and the hollandaise had just a touch more flavor. The poutine was our favorite thing; could use a bit more of the gravy but still delicious. I would like to return some day for a second chance.

When you wake up groggy from a night of fighting with electrical issues, you want breakfast that can be delivered quick and be hearty. Well, I found it with Wendy's yesterday. Through their magical app, where you can also get points for freebies later, I placed the order for the fam, it gets dispatched to the store, and DoorDash handles the logistics. I was lucky enough to not only have a Dasher close by for immediate pickup, the order was correct, and most importantly HOT!!!! This store goes through its pains of staffing and sometimes does not always read notes in full. The only reason I'm giving 4-stars this go around is a miss on some order notes. When someone requests coffee with cream and sugar, sugar is not equal and sweet & low; both of which not the best for the body. Other than that the cold brew was amazing!!! Thanks for great food and a great recharge at an affordable value and was worth every bit of it and delivered in just about 25-30 minutes time. Can't wait to order again soon!!!

My first time visiting the P&P on Grant after being a loyal Campbell Ave customer. I don't know if it's the 'state of things' or what, and it's subtle but still, I noticed corners cut. I've ordered the everything croissant sammie, like, every time I come. It's the best. And I know what it COULD be. And this one, well, WASN'T. This time it seemed like there's less 'everything' on the croissant, the whole thing wasn't really warm, the eggs were weird flat scrambled patties, the cheese wasn't exactly melted, and the croissant itself wasn't as fluffy and awesome. The crispy potatoes were mostly whole. Don't get me wrong, the flavors were there. But it wasn't the same. If this is what it's going to be like from now on I'll be sad. Still top notch French 75s though!
Excellent food best brunch in town Wish there was more of a seasonal variety Love they are in the Wesley chapel area and are close to shopping
Frank's closed for good... Out of Business. Sad. New restaurant and bar scheduled to open in early 2022 according to sign on door, called OTR (On The Rocks LLC).
Not a put lot of Places to eat in Land O'Lakes I found this to be delicious Locos sitting everywhere very popular place food is delicious good job Chef

Found a new Chinese spot on the block and we decided to give it a try. My boyfriend thought the soy ribs were okay. It had good flavor but it was on the dry side. The salt & pepper shrimp was pretty good. Did not lack in flavor. The combo fried noodles was probably everyone's favorite. The fried pot stickers is a 8/10. Lastly, the bao was probably the most disappointing thing for me. It was so salty that I felt like it was dipped into the ocean. Hopefully they make the bao less salty in the future. Overall, everything was pretty good. Environment : This location is the old Korean restaurant. Everything inside still remains the same. Therefore, the parking spots are still tight and small. Service: there was a nice sweet man that greeted us and cashed us out. The restaurant itself didn't have many customers when we arrived so hopefully this business gets more customers so it can keep running. I would rate this place a 7/10 from the food we got.

This is a good place for breakfast! We go often. The pancakes are huge. The skillets are delicious. The French toast is yummy. The OJ is refreshing. They try to be as healthy as possible. There are several options for those watching their diet & vegetarians. They always have these nutritious juice blends. They also write certain seasonal specials on the chalk board. The service is great. People are very friendly & helpful. I definitely recommend.

Good bagels with a multitude of different fixings. They are always busy, which is a good sign! I am not a coffee lover but my husband is and he has been very happy with his choices. I am looking forward to returning and trying the biscuits and gravy!

I first had this 4 years ago in cincy. When I found out they had a location in Indy, I had to go. I ordered the same exact meal I had 4 years ago plus a few extras. The chicken club, Mac and cheese, sweet potatoes, cornbread, succotash, herb fries. It was CFP championship day so they were prepping for the long night. We got there at 4 right when they opened and they were already crowded. The sandwhich was good, It didn't wow me like before. The Mac and cheese are just spiral noodles with a wet cheese sauce, the sweet potatoes were cold and the marshmallows were charred but not warm (these were replaced and not charged when we requested a fresh order), fries were delicious and flavorful, the cornbread was probably my favorite side, the succotash was also cold. I'm not taking off many stars because I understand the rush and trying to be prepared. The 4 stars is cause the flavor was there, was just lacking in temperature. Would def go back to watch a sports game, it's the perfect set up!

I come here every trip to New Orleans sometimes I eat here twice. If it is lunch, it the Ferdi, if it is breakfast, it's an shrimp étouffée omelette. Trust me, don't be talked into substituting shrimp creole for shrimp étouffée; it's no contest.

So glad they opened this second location so I don't have to hunt for and then pay for parking to visit the restaurant. Also don't have to contend with the traffic on Mandalay Avenue. Friendly staff. I ordered takeout of tuna and salmon nigiri and it was very FRESH, well packed, with high quality ginger and strong wasabi. Look forward to visiting again. I ordered my takeout by walking into the store, but I noticed today that there's a separate door or window around the corner, on the side street, that said "PICKUP" or "TAKEOUT." Will try that next time. Full bar.

Spent a Saturday afternoon on the rooftop and had the best time, it's a Broadway bar so I wasn't surprised when some of the drinks had a soft poor but the overall live music and atmosphere and decorations made this one of my favorite spots. Although I didn't eat at this location and cannot speak on the I recommend the rooftop and drinks to anyone visiting Nashville!

I eat here at least twice a week. This particular location always runs out of essential ingredients in the evening, such as avocado, certain type of bread, arugula, certain cheese, certain chicken, even apple--you name it, they don't have it. Not sure if this is part of the supply chain issue or it's just not properly managed. Other than the "sold out" issue mentioned above, it's a typical Panera Bread.
Awesome cookies of all types and flavors. A bit crazy on a weekend night and a small place with no organization but...with the wait!

Got two pizzas for takeout on NYE. The husband and I really liked the traditional hand-stretched crust. We got the rosemary potato and the wild mushroom pizzas, and they let me order the wild mushroom with red sauce (as opposed to the traditional white). I thought the rosemary potato was a litttttle too salty (the spinach or the olive tapenade) and had to alternate bites with the crust to even out the flavors, but the wild mushroom was excellent. Will definitely dine in to try some of their other pizzas and entrees at some point!

The ambience is great. .and so is the food!! My favorite was ceviche which was made at the table, and was delicious. Quantity is similar to other Mexican restaurants..overall we left with a happy experience. Thanks.
We have ordered from here a couple of times and it never disappoints. Everything from the wraps, burgers and pizza is great. I highly recommend the grandma pizza and the avocado wrap!

Really nice restaurant! Fast service great staff, giving it a 4 star review just because I didn't like my dish lasy time, next time I'll try something else! Everyone else in my party LOVED their food! Definitely give it a try!

We had our order delivered to our hotel which was so convenient after a day's travel. The lemon chicken was absolutely delicious The chicken with cashews was so good had a great kick to it. We had our order in about an hour hot and fresh.

Had a couple of martinis here with my fiancé and was very happy with how delicious the drinks were. Didn't realize how expensive food was, would probably come here for a special occasion due to the price however I would definitely come back for drinks. We came on a Monday so it wasn't very busy, and the weather made it too cold to sit outside. Heard great things about this place so I'll come back during summer to enjoy the outdoor patio.

Jeannine's is a nice breakfast and brunch spot across from the wharf with ocean views. I ordered a simple two egg breakfast with toast and fresh squeezed orange juice. I placed a to go order and enjoyed my breakfast in the sand! The staff were very welcoming and quickly took my order. While I waited, I noticed how cute and quaint this place is. I was quickly served and left to the beach to enjoy. I would say my breakfast was about 3.5 and the juice and service was a 5! My eggs and potatoes were meh and sourdough was good. I think next time I will try a pastry (that seems to be the thing to get at Jeannine's).

Came here to try a new joint for dinner and drinks. It reminds me of a friends basement bar. Drinks were poured well and there is an entire page of the giant menu dedicated to BURGERS. The Cajun burger, add bacon and Guac was delicious.

Love almost everything there. Their Generals is not traditional Generals but its great. Hot and sour soup is great. Fantastic eggrolls. Their weakest dish is their fried rice...not very good. Dry and not much meat in it. Other than. That I recommend the Generals, mandarin chicken, Korean bulgogi, sweet and sour chicken, sweet and sour pork, shrimp and garlic sauce.
Great place for seafood! We got the boil bucket for 2. Free hush puppies with meal. The crab was a tad overcooked, but they replaced it. Waitress was attentive and food was tasty!

Such a nice addition to the neighborhood, very cozy and delicious. The speak-easy downstairs is pretty neat too. I would have given Bocca 5 stars, but I came here with friends one time and checked the website to see if they were open, they were... but once we got there they were closed for a private party with the doors locked. Also, came for a birthday celebration and the owner/manager was slightly cold. My recommendations, the baked goat cheese and beet salad to start. For an entree, the della casa, but substitute the shrimp for ground sausage. Finally, finish it off with the bombolini.
Excellent choices of sushi and our server was actually friendly compared to the other AYCE sushi joints. We tried them all and would go back to this one.

Today is an updated S/O to Molly Mallory's on the continued and quality products they deliver to the customers! Today I wanted to bring friends from out of town to get a great breakfast! The portions are always sizable and the service was great! The drinks that accompanied our meal were just what we needed! We all took home a 'Pop Tart'! This filling was citrus flavored grapefruit...So Yummy! Keep Doing Your Thing Molly's & I'll Keep Coming Back For More!

Some of the best chicken wings anywhere PERIOD. Hooters got nothing on these wings. KFC you must have missed the cooking lesson that the head chef here attended cause you could use the help. This would open Popeye's other eye in surprise. Nowhere in Buffalo can touch this place and I hit at least 15 places up there looking for great wings. Oh, BTW, They have great Pho Ga and other Vietnamese dishes. Only big negative is that they do not have a grilled chicken dish on the menu. So my go to Grilled Chicken Vermicelli is absent and no 5 starts for this place.

Classic dishes with a historical NOLA feel. I loved the decor and music of Brennan's! I felt transported back in time. We ordered the "A Chanteclaire Christmas" and "Advent En Audubon" and they both tasted well balanced. I really enjoyed my turtle soup and my boyfriend enjoyed his potato rosti. The ham and eggs were a little dry in our croque madames. I also couldn't really taste the black truffle in the croque madame. My boyfriend thought the cheddar grits were very good. The banana foster was great! I loved the flambé at the table. I was a little disappointed that we didn't get to hear the history of the banana foster that I heard other servers explaining to the tables around us. Despite the minor critiques I've written, I would recommend Brennan's to friends and family. I would like to return to try their dinner menu in the future!

Cool vibe, great drinks, inside and outside seating. Great menu This is a great place to go for a date night or drinks with friends. It can get loud on the weekends because it's such a fun place to be. I love how they offer indoor and outdoor seating but all is covered so if you have a typical Florida rain you're OK. The menu is creative the food is good and the drinks are amazing!
Good chi gao but could use mint leaves and or cilantro. The place was very busy which is a good sign. And at 2 that's impressive!

We tried this place for the first time for lunch. It was really good and the portions are large. We shared our entrees I had the gyro with roasted potatoes and my husband tried the calamari which came with rice, bread, green beans and potatoes. The location is on a side street from 36 you may not see it from 36 but worth looking for. Next time we're definitely trying the flaming cheese appetizer. Back here today for lunch. They have a nice variety of options from appetizers, sandwiches and entrees for lunch. There's even a lighter side option served with a salad and smaller portion for lunch or dinner.
New to St. Louis, checking out everything recommended. Brussel sprouts were good, the fish sandwich was better than okay, and the burger was okay. The drinks and service were excellent.

I might not have noticed this place, as it is on the lower level of the building. A Too Good to Go offer brought me in, and I'm so glad I know it is here. It's the only cafe I've seen that offers misugaru, a grain-based breakfast drink. Since I'd only ever had it from the instant packets that a friend shared with me, I had to give that a try. They've got breakfast sandwiches with bibimbap that I need to go back to try. And the dalgona coffee, too. They use local La Colombe and Caphê coffees and Philly muffins. Great local business!

Loved the area & ambience, super cute. We only got to try one item but will be back for sure. The Smoked Pastrami Reuben on Seeded Rye was delicious. It was a good portion & tasted really good. We split it. The mustard was a bit too much for me & burnt my nose. My husband loves meat and he said he wishes it had more meat it in. The side salad was very nice & refreshing, with great dressing.

Great place to hang quietly with a friend. This establishment utilizes local farmers, bakers, etc. Everything I have ever tried here has been great. I found a sandwich that I was in love with, but they removed it from the menu! Great grilled cheese here!!! Handmade aprons and cool little gifts... Definitely check it out. The staff is super nice! Avocado BLT, Chicken Goat, Roast Beef Sandwich, and Charcuterie are some great choices.

I've been on hunt for a great study/work spot to hang out in when I need a change of scenery and I got just that. The atmosphere is so inviting and cozy here. There is plenty of seating so you don't have to worry about popping in for work and not being able to find a seat. The noise level was also perfect. I was a little worried that because this is a bigger coffee shop and it's downtown, it may be loud but it really wasn't. I ordered a cafe con leche and a Cuban sandwich and everything tasted delicious, flavorful and fresh. They do make the cafe con leche with condensed milk instead of regular milk which resulted in a foamier coffee. However the Cuban sandwich was made to perfection. I can tell it was fresh because the cheese melts away with each bite and each component of the sandwich was crispy and hot just the way I love it! All in all, if you're looking for a chill study or workspace, I'd encourage you to stop by. I can't wait to come back!

Stopped here for lunch since I have never been to one before. Our waitress was very nice and patient with us since we had to research the menu a little before ordering. I ordered the half salad half club sandwich meal. It was a much larger portion size than I expected and was very good. I had to take home half of the sandwich. Prices were fair and they do have a full bar if you are interested. I will be back next time I am in town.

We wanted to try out the Thai place so we decided to have dinner at Veggie Thai Cafe. It is a small cafe run by the family. After browsing through the menu we decided to order Crispy Spring Rolls, Veggie Pad Thai and Veggie Red Curry. We got our order in 10 minutes. The food was freshly cooked and it was hot. The spring rolls were perfectly fried as well as we loved the pad Thai and vegetable red curry. It was different from the normal Thai restaurant as it was all cooked with veggies.

We stopped at Famous Dave's after a morning of shopping and we enjoyed the meal! The lunch specials are great and comes with 1, 2, or 3 meats; a side; and a cornbread muffin (which was frankly the best cornbread I've ever had). I ordered the 2 meat combo ($11.50 at lunch) and requested the brisket and the bbq chicken. The brisket was flavorful and juicy, which was great. The chicken was OK. it was definetly juicy which is good, but I wish I would've realized I could've asked for the spicier sauce. The original BBQ sauce is just too sweet for my liking. Ultimately, I think we'll be back if we're ever wanting some bbq!

Very nice. 4,25 Unassuming nice little spot, friendly service and nice conversation w/ what might be the owner or manager. Sangria and beer. Lots of delivery-take-out happening. If anyone had to wait on their pick up, they were offered a water or drink while they wait. Super nice. We tried the lomo salteado, which did not disappoint- steak, soy, garlic onions tomato peppers still a bit crispy fry base and side of fluffy arroz. Hubs tried the chaufa chicken , Peruvian fried rice, ok but a little 5 spice flavor which we don't love. It's like cilantro, not everyone is a fan! Eager to try the rotisserie chicken and maybe a delightful delicious dessert!

Iron Hill's are really good. Their food is actually better than their beer and there isn't anything wrong with the beer. These are big and clean places. They are perfect restaurants for first dates, business meals and family time. Lots of choices of yummy comfort food and an original selection of beers. I wouldn't go out of my way just for the beer but I would for the overall experience.

This is a family owned pizzeria. It's my favorite neighborhood spot for cheesesteaks or pasta dishes (Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo). The restaurant is clean, ample seating. There is a small outside seating area that is put up outside during the summer months, when the weather permits. COVID-19 protocols are practiced here. The owners are very friendly, helpful and inviting. I have not had a bad meal here. This is my go to spot when I have cheesesteak cravings. The cheesesteaks only come in one size. Hot sandwiches, cold sandwiches, pasta dishes, salads are a few categories to choose from. You can dine in or order to go. You can even use food delivery services. Grub Hub or Doordash provide coverage for this establishment. Cash/Credit or debit are accepted here.

Delicious chicken, yummy sauce, friendly staff, and crinkle fries! I usually don't like crinkle fries because they remind me of old soggy school cafeteria fries... & these fries came kind of soggy, but I was able to reheat my fries in the airfryer at home which made them 1000x better!!! The toast that came with the chicken finger combo was nice and buttery. The buns on the sandwich combo was soft and fresh. The chicken is so well-seasoned! I couldn't stop dipping the fries in the sauce! Sooo good! The drive thru line is usually busy, but for good reason!! So if you ever see it not busy, GO GET SOME! Even if you're not hungry. Bring it home and reheat it in the airfryer. If you don't have an airfryer, what year are you living in????? How are you surviving life without one?? Go get some chicken and an airfryer.

We visited the restaurant on a Sunday for brunch and they were pretty busy so we had an hour wait. Which wasn't a big deal because we just walked on Central avenue and grabbed some coffee until we received the text that our table is ready. The staff was friendly and the food was great. The atmosphere is nice, indoor/outdoor vibe. I wish the menu wasn't so limited but my sandwich was yummy! I also tried my friend's vegan sandwich and that was delightful as well! I want to come back one day to try their ceviche :)

We ordered artichoke pizza, which was excellent. I a had a brisket sandwich with delicious fries. My fiancé had the toasted ravioli with excellent marinara. The service was par, but nothing to write home about, however the restaurant was busy during the lunch rush hour. This is a good restaurant and a safe bet for good food if in the Lafayette square area

We ordered takeout for the first time from here. Went to pick it up and the place was dark and thought it looked closed. Opened the door and it was bright and active. Full bar area and lots of people. Got the Tuesday special with pepperoni and a Greek salad. Both were very good and filling. Next time I want to go and stay, looked like a good crowd with a fun staff.

I visited your establishment with a group of 12. Crystal did a great job on providing great service. I enjoyed the Pork Ossobuco. The rest of the group enjoyed there meals as well. My only surprise through out the evening is when I asked for an espresso. How can an Italian Restaurant not have espresso? If had one suggestion that is what I would suggest.

I made reservations a week in advance due to the weekend being New Years Eve weekend. Checking in was smooth, the host sat us early. It took a while for the waitress to take our order but it wasn't a huge issue since we weren't in a rush. The restaurant had a special NYE menu that day so we weren't able to try the other dishes which is shown in the other customer's images. That was disappointing since there wasn't a huge selection of dishes that night. So I felt a bit robbed. Anyway, I ordered a half dozen oysters, gator bites, and the Louisiana sampler (jambalaya, crawfish Étouffée, red beans and rice, and gumbo), and for dessert the Bananas foster bread pudding. Everything was delicious. I highly recommend the fresh oysters. The service was okay. Our waitress came off a little rude, slightly impatient, but I didn't want to hold it against her because it was a busy night. I just hope she doesn't act like that towards customers everyday. I do plan on returning in the future hoping that I'll get to try a full menu, instead of a limited menu.

This place has great pizza. My usual go tos' - margarita pizza and plain with olives. Was perfectly sauced and toasted, thin and crispy perfection the way I prefer it. I usually just get pizza here, but the wings were good too!

Great breakfast! The sausage, country potatoes and eggs over easy were all great tasting. The sausage was fresh tasting with great flavor. The potatoes were seasoned with spices I couldn't name, but I know good food. My orange was a nice compliment instead of coffee. However, my partner had coffee. There was no bread product that came with the meal, but since the restaurant also has a bakery there were lots of yummy choices. I ordered a chocolate eclair as a special breakfast dessert. The cream was thick and delicious on the eclair. It was way too much to eat, so I had some left over for later. The negative comments I have is that food was ordered at register and NO cash payments. One waiter/bus person for entire restaurant, so coffee refills were slow and waiter/bus person had to be flagged down for refills. Lastly, I liked the options of where to dine. Indoor or outdoors. We chose the outdoor table under an umbrella. It was perfect!

Ate at the bar. Excellent margaritas. Not the cheap mix that gives me a headache, but fresh squeezed lime. The shrimp basket and grouper fish taco (a little cold) were delicious. Loses a star because this place is an absolute zoo. I feel like I was battling for a bar seat to avoid an hour wait. A place you should go at least once, but too crazy busy and took forever to get food, not to mention the level of aggression you must use to get the bar tenders attention.

I visited blind tiger for the first time today after being a loyal Starbucks addict and i must admit, blind tiger has Starbucks beat by a long shot. I ordered a 16oz vanilla butterbean hot latte with almond mild and it was delicious. Not super sweet and a perfect brew. They also sell teas, pastries, hot breakfast, and bags of tea to brew at home. The only reason i didn't give a full 5 stars is because they are very expensive. The coffee was $8.06 and that would've afford me a venti coffee at Starbucks at least.

I had a pizza craving and stopped here for a bite to eat. The pizza was fantastic and did not disappoint. The Toscano Pizza hit the spot with spinach, tomato and ricotta. I noticed they offer take out but no delivery which is another option. There are pasta choices too as the name implies. I have been here before and ordered a pasta meal. Either option is good eats. The only downside to this restaurant is the on-site parking. It wasn't an issue for me but could be a problem if you visit during a busy time. I did notice alternate parking on the other side of the street if on-site parking is not available.

I ordered pizza's and jalapeño poppers for my family who were driving in from Ohio. I ordered a large pepperoni pizza, a Sicilian Mama's Supreme and two orders of jalapeño poppers. The pepperoni pizza was a thin crust and any of there Sicilian pizza's are a thick crust. My family loved the pizza's and poppers. The sauce was a little to sweet for me, but tasted good overall.

One of the best Tres Leches cakes I have ever had ( and I really like Tres Leches) The cake was spongy and had the perfect texture for absorbing the milk. Even leftover, it was not soggy, and still delicious. I highly recommend this bakery for this cake and their fresh Mexican pastries.

Pros: Cocktail shrimp appetizer was fresh and tasty, side of peewee potatoes were delicious, but the salad was an experiment gone awry. They just didn't pull off whatever they were attempting with the salad.

We had some initial confusion with the hostesses about getting a table, as we did not have a reservation, but were seated at a nice table in the bar which was wonderful. Friendly service, good food...enjoyed the salads and sushi a lot. Just a note here that their Covid policy is outdated. Idaho is no longer in a state of emergency and totally open. Some employees choose to wear masks.

My father-in-law wanted to share this special place with us. He lived in the area for years, and this was his "go to". We had such a fun time! The trout was incredible, but I loved my husband's red fish even more...literally one of the best bites of fish I have ever had! We all had appetizers that were incredible, and the drinks were pretty great! I love that our experience lasted for hours...it was just a fun way to spend the evening! I was kind of excited because I had been told that it was an establishment were the men had to wear jackets, and my father-in-law pointed out the extra jackets inside (to go to those who didn't wear one upon entering?). They didn't seem to make anyone do that, which isn't a big deal as a whole, but for him, the "specialness" of it had seemed to dissipate over the years, and he felt like the standards weren't quite the same as they were back in the early 2000's.
It's not my favorite, but it does good in a pinch. I like the carne asada burrito, but make sure to use the sauces! If you're not willing to wait in a potentially long line, don't go!

I order from Ginza at least once a week. My husband prefers their sushi and gyoza over a pricier spot a few blocks north. The seaweed salad is always fresh and tasty. The ribs are delicious. The owners/staff are always kind. The bento boxes are a great deal. I'm so happy to have Ginza nearby!

Food and drinks were all excellent extremely delicious! I'm giving 4 Stars for prices my husband myself and our toddler ate there for lunch yesterday $90 that's more than any steakhouse but it was really good!!

The ambiance at Stateside was unmatched. The DJ was popping off and the bar was also so fun, it was really fun as a big group of girls. Here is a recap of of food: Apple Cider Mimosa and Frosée- both delicious and strong, I think the Frosée was better. Baked Crab dip and Monkey bread to share- Crab dip hit the spot, we loved the Monkey Bread but wished it was bigger/more gooey. I had the Stateside Omelette which was good but nothing special. The food was pretty good but we mostly loved the drinks/ambiance. Super fun for a big group.

Third time at Alfredos Cafe and its been beyond wonderful every singe time. From Mexican breakfast to chicken sandwiches to smoothies this place is a for sure win! Thank you Alfredos ! See you guys again soon..

First visit to this location, Sister had purchased gift certificate for Mom and wife and I. Ambience was nice and they seemed to be clean, compliant in all the rules and regulations. I like the open kitchen concept, entertaining if you are close enough to watch. Location was reasonably full, good to see, for a 6:15 reservation. Reservation was on time and set up ahead for us and appreciated. Initial service and drinks were prompt. Food was delivered in a timely fashion and delicious. Everybody enjoyed their selections. There were only a couple of very minor missteps by the server but corrected quickly. Overall, a pleasant experience. Dropped one star as I felt, for the price point, the portions could be a bit larger.

Used to be the B-Line which makes me nervous about restaurant turnover in same location. However, Great little burger joint. Seating is tight but the food is tasty. Also good selection of beers. We had the 420 Burger wasn't too spicy as the cream cheese counters it nicely. My group also had the Thunder Bacon BAMF which the 15yr old inhaled so I'm really sure he tasted it. Best Compliment I can give is that I'd go back.

TL;DR - Good, but somewhat forgettable. Skip the pad thai, definitely order a seasonal cocktail, and be prepared to wait. Pros: The service was wonderful and the drinks blew us away. I got a Thai Iced Tea that was wonderful and my partner ordered an Old Fashioned. The staff was incredibly friendly and sociable. Also, they offer a digitized wait list so that you can see where your party is at on the wait list and how long you've been waiting. Cons: The food didn't live up to the hype. It was good food, don't get me wrong, but my expectations were pretty high after hearing raving reviews from others. Also, we were quoted a 25-30 minute wait and we ended up waiting almost an hour. It's a pretty small place and it doesn't take reservations. While they do offer a digital, real-time wait list that you can view on your phone to see your place in line, the digital wait list doesn't provide a time estimate for the wait. (Which I do recognize is more of an art form rooted in experience rather than a science.)

Me and my wife just loved going here on Friday and Saturday nights for live bands and lots and lots of dancing with great people. My memories of this bar, just make me cry with how much fun me and my wife had going here. She had been dead 9 years now. But my memories of going to Tuners are so strong in my mind. I stop in every once in awhile. I live 30 miles away now. . Which was no problem when the wife was ok, but things change. I really miss the place so very much.
Great late night pizza spot in the french quarter. Cant beat it. Good location near convenience stores and xheaoer than most other tourist spots.

What a great hidden gem! Stopped by for lunch and drinks and it did not disappoint. I look forward to coming back here to try more of the items on the menu and soaking up the atmosphere. Get the coconut shrimp!

Barcelona Pizza has been my go-to spot every Sunday. I'm from Philly so I need me a good cheese steak from here and there and this is the place to go! Their Pizza is "so so" I have had good pies from them and I have had pies that taste like a school lunch but over all I like the establishment and will continue to try different things.

came here for sushi and the menu is quite small but very good!!! one of the best sushi places i've been too!!! and they have i think 2 billiards tables!! very nice inside. they also have nice outdoor seating. good service. 10/10

The Pour House is our weekend staple. No matter when we go we can always find a seat which is surprising considering how awesome this place is. The food is alway delicious and it's a perfect place for a Sunday Fun Day.

Literally the BEST sushi restaurant in Tampa. Everything is fresh and so good. The employees are super friendly and helpful. Their Krab Rangoons are made in house and are the BEST I've ever had. They also sell Picnic Boxes for a perfect date night idea. Saturday night music nights are a plus also.

Wine society is the most adorable little find ! The decor is so beautiful and it's such a cozy spot ! The service is great , they always have specials and their charcuterie boards are amazing ! Awesome place for dates or just a good time with your closest girls !

My family and I have been dining here for 15+ years. We have lived in the area for 25+ years. This is hands down the best restaurant in the area within 20 miles. The service is second to none, bartenders are excellent, and the entire staff is friendly and welcoming. You will feel at home with a dining experience here. The appetizers are eclectic, sure to entice anyone's pallet. The entrees offered include a a handful of pastas, ranging from seafood to excellent spaghetti w/ meatballs. The steak options will suffice for anyone choosing a beef option, topped with garlic and an abundance of seasoning. The house salad is a must. The seasoning and amount of cheese is perfect. Very limited outside dining, but the atmosphere of inside dining is worth going indoors. Furthermore, they have a ton of dessert options to make any celebration worth dining here. Would highly recommend this restaurant if you're in the South County, MO area.

great place to hang out and grab a latte and read a book. the ambiance is very homie - and they have pages from old books cascading from the ceiling. there isn't a whole lot in terms of seating, but it is an intimate coffee shop with books that you can purchase. i love the wooden center bar in the middle of the store, it definitely adds to the environment. i got one of their seasonal latte's, and it was perfect. Milky, frothy, and not too sweet. I'll definitely come back, and it feels like the perfect place to go on a snow day
Fun place with nice bar selection of all kinds of local draft beers. This place brought me back to my childhood of playing super Nintendo in my room as a teenager. Pizza could be better, just ok.

My new FAVORITE in Dunedin/Tampa Bay. Had Yucatan style Torta Pibil which was outstanding, served with a green salsa similar to argentine chimichurri. Served with excellent warm fresh chips and red salsa with a nice kick. Can't wait to work thru more of a very interesting menu! The offerings far exceed the standard fare! Decor is very comfy with saltillo tile floor, walls adorned with mexican plates and artwork and good lighting. Take the time to get here!!

When RJ asked what I wanted for my birthday, I said Rice. It is always consistently delicious and the staff is always friendly and attentive. Melly was our server and she was terrific. We both started with a Mai Tai and.a spicy Kani salad. This is one of our favorite versions, fresh and spicy. We shared pan fried pork gyoza which were crisp and juicy. RJ ordered the Mikasa roll and I ordered the Mango Paradise Roll which is my favorite sushi roll of all the places we have had sushi. The mikasa used to be the hairy Mexican which is shrimp tempura, Kani, and spicy Mayo and eel sauce. The Mango paradise is lobster tempura with mango, avocado in soy paper with peanuts and spicy mango sauce. Both rolls were phenomenal and there were no leftovers!

Great food, great drinks, great server! First time in Clearwater, we looked up Cooters and thought it was our kind of joint. It was better than expected. We split the Daytona Tequila wings, shrimp dip, crab stuffed shrooms and blackened gator tail. We couldn't finish it all. The rum runner, banana split and pirate punch were awesome! We will definitely be returning!

Great help when we came off a 12 hour drive. I mentioned we were at a nearby hotel. Food was hot and ready in 15 minutes. The female packed everything we needed knowing we had nothing. Hot and sour soup was just like I like it. Excellent fried rice.

Definitely my favorite take out during Covid,hands down. Everything was great from the salad to dessert. Not all restaurants were good at this in the covid pandemic. They did an outstanding job!Really well done. Nothing cold or greasy. I think the price equals the quality of food and service. Highly recommend The Capital Grille. They will not disappoint.

I have been wanting to go to this restaurant and it did not disappoint. The service and the food were phenomenal. We started with cocktails and calamari and I must say the cranberry bourbon cocktail is . Our entrees (pictured below) included the snapper, romano crusted chicken and the famous tortelloni Michelangelo. All full of spice and delicious. It was also nice to be able to sit and enjoy dinner for a couple of hours with friends without being rushed. It's really enjoyable evening.

In a day and age when good service is hard to find, exceptional service is a rare treat. We had the very good fortune to be waited on by Markqus this evening and received just that - exceptional service. He's the guy you want to enhance your dining experience. Oh yeah, and the food was great. Delicious Grouper Sandwich and someone in our group just raved about her burger! This was our first time here and we will be back!
I enjoyed the menu and the laid-back atmosphere. I will definitely return. Loved the crab and the bison tacos! I went 2 days in a row. Lobster Nibblets were great as well.

Been coming to this establishment for awhile now, usually I sit at a table, but this particular night I decided to sit at the bar instead. Chelsea is the best bartender there is. She made us laugh, she made our drinks right in front of us, and they were so delicious. Another fun night for the books.

Great Indian food spot, and a helpful staff as well. Discovered some new indian food faves thanks to this place! Their lamb khorma (spelling) will make anyone a Indian food fan, guaranteed. Vindaloo and mansala, many excellent dishes. Been coming for years and is always good!

So impressed with this restaurant! I haven't been able to find great sushi in North Pinellas since Jo-To's in Countryside closed several years ago. We've been here several times for lunch and everything has been great--very fresh, HUGE portions and ridiculously fair prices! They have a great assortment of Bento boxes as well as regular and fancy rolls and appetizers. I've had all the tuna and avocado rolls as well as some of the Tempura ones; all delicious. The restaurant is EXCEPTIONALLY clean, including the bathrooms, and the inside seating is pleasant and serene. Really nice spot for a quiet, cozy lunch. We feel very fortunate to have Sakura within walking distance and we can see they've already built up a nice customer base. Publix sushi NO MORE!

This is the only local ShopRite I will go to. It's always clean, staff is usually on the floor restocking throughout the store and there are never long lines when I'm there. It's a nice store and the parking lot is not gigantic so parking is always a breeze too!
The environment was great. Absolutely loved the self serve beer it was a great way to keep our party entertained and the white pizza, AMAZING

I ordered takeout from Juan's Flying Burrito for the first time and really enjoyed it! I am gluten free, but they are able to make any of the burritos as a bowl. I ordered the Al pastor and it was delicious! I cant wait to come back!

Went there for lunch today. Fabulous meal. Had the house salad with raspberry vinaigrette. Fabulous. Entree was flaky fish with lemon wine sauce. Fabulous. Like to know what type of fish they used. Please respond. Creme brûlée was fabulous. Will return monthly. Thank you guys & gals.
I can here for a tournament and I ate here everyday it was so good! I recommend for anybody considering coming to Tucson Arizona.
Very nice, helpful employees. They were only taking mobile orders but the app is not user friendly and needs a search button. They gave the kids cookies. They were very patient..
Owners are so nice and food is to die for!!!!! Best Thai ever!!!! Food made with love from owners family recipes!!!

One of my favorite Italian spots in Indy. Great place for a date or dinner with the girls. Highly recommend the sausage and fig flatbread. The sausage pasta is one of my go to's. Servers are well versed in wine recs.

First time here! Found this place via Yelp and Google. We ordered the Half Rack ribs (mango habanero) combo with fries and a drink, and also Bone of 9 wings (garlic parmesan). The wings came out crispy and perfectly seasoned with garlic parmesan and large wings compared to some other wings joints. The side of ranch was not needed but definitely nice for additional dipping! The half rack ribs were cut into smaller pieces for easy chewing and the mango habanero flavor is delicious. The fries taste fresh and are crunchy, but lacks a bit of flavor. I hope they add a garlic parmesan fries to their menu! I will definitely be back to try the different wings flavors!

Everyone please come here and support this business!!! The chicken is amazing!!! SOOOO CRISPY! Better than Bonchon!! The service is amazing and so quick. We came on a Sunday afternoon and dined in. The chicken was spicy but we wanted the spicy flavors. One of the best Korean fried chicken wings I've had! They also have grilled wings too. We also got the fried chicken sandwich and that was amazing too!!! I'm so glad this opened up in the neighborhood and wish I came here sooner!! My mouth is watering writing this thinking about how good their food was! Can't wait to come back!!

This tiny place just off Tyrone Blvd is hidden at the end a small strip mall. Had to do a U-Turn because I missed it on the first pass but well worth the effort. The all you can eat sushi dinner menu at ($27 per person. All-You-Can-Eat lunch also available at a lower price) is quite a deal. I have paid $8 for a single sushi roll at other establishments. So there is no doubt you will get your moneys' worth here. Our waitress Elena brought our selections to the table so quickly I was wondering where she kept her super-heroine cape! All-you-can-eat restaurants rely on giving you a good long wait time before delivering selections to allow you to become full. NOT HERE AT UMAMI!!! My son and I would be just finishing a plate when Elena would bring another one. At no time were we waiting for selections to be delivered. Large portions of Wasabi and Ginger were delivered upon request, and Elena was quick to top off our water as well. Dirty dishes were whisked away to make room for full dishes and Elena helped explain our menu selections. I mentioned that they could skip the rice to make room for more fish, and from that point forward all the entrees that were not rolls came with no rice. I don't often give 5 stars. This is a restaurant that prides itself on delivering an outstanding dining experience.

I try to keep my reviews leaning positive and give recognition where it's due. Stopped into Cloud 9 on Sunday night to get out of the house and grab a drink with my gf. We sat on the south side, with the smaller bar. There are some tvs to watch the game, but it's a cozy spot and not loud. From the start, our server Jessica was very friendly and attentive, even though it looked like she was moving around a bit to take care of stuff in the back and prep silverware. The only tricky part was figuring out what we wanted, but she talked to us about their beer and food options and brought out samples. Just a pleasant experience and you can tell everyone (customers and staff) enjoyed it there. I got the standard burger and it was great. Their beer selection is solid, I had the amber and double IPA and my gf loves the honey basil. Will come back for beer/sports/food.

Went here while out exploring the area and had the Kung Fu beef noodle soup, medium spicy. Definitely could've been a little spicier but otherwise it was excellent. The staff is also very friendly and the restaurant is clean.

I want everyone in the Philadelphia metropolitan area to descend on this place like suburban moms going to the strip mall on Black Friday morning. I want whoever is reading this to drop your phone right now, leave your house in whatever you're wearing, and hit the road. Because I want this place to become so popular that it never closes down. If you've never had a mochi ring donut, it's deep fried like a regular yeast donut, but made with tapioca/rice flour, which gives them a more springy consistency and slightly different flavor. (That description doesn't feel quite right... you just have to try them to understand). The icings are also better than average donut shops because they have things like yuzu, black sesame, and taro. They also have more traditional icings like strawberry or Nutella, but super-flavorful. To add icing to all of the icing you'll already have, they serve really great bubble tea. And corn dogs that are kind of hard to describe but you should eat them. And that's a full, balanced meal, folks.

My go to neighborhood Chinese restaurant. They always get my order right. Food is made very quickly and fresh. Reasonable prices. The kung poa chicken is soo tasty. The general Taos has a light sweetness and isn't coated in too much breading. The Mongolian beef was very tender.

Loved the variety in fisherman's feast. Mini lobster rolls were amazing. Great food! Priced well. Would definitely recommend. I know some people are saying it's a tad pricey. Which is probably so. However, I've heard the rent in the "currents of windermere" is absolutely insane so I can't fault them for being a tad high on the price what so ever.

This place is some of the BEST BBQ I've ever had! I've had it all chicken, ribs, beef brisket, smoked sausage it's all fantastic!!! For your side make sure you get the baked beans - you can thank me later :). The also have yummy fried catfish, chicken strips and wings! Just eat here - you won't regret it!!!

Awesome little pizza spot, personal pies made to order with tons of options. Went in for the lunch special, pizza and a drink for $9. Everything we ate was delicious and the staff was awesome. Def will be back!
Wonderful atmosphere even though I was waiting to pick up it was still very welcoming. The pizza came out hot and it smelled/tasted delicious! Will go back again!

I'm not sure why people are saying the pizza isn't great - it's some of the best Philly pizza for sure, and they have so much variety. I've also ordered the cauliflower crust and it is WOW. Amazing, you cannot tell a difference aside from the pizza itself being a little smaller (it's only $15/pie, though). Crisp, doesn't taste weird, and delicious. When I went in for dining, We got the octopus which was cooked well, the Caesar salad which was very good, and a sashimi dish that was fresh and delicious. We also got the tavern style pizza with dairy free cheese and it was shockingly amazing. I'm not sure what brand of dairy free cheese they use, buts it's the best DF pie in the city for sure, and the thin crust is awesome. Their cocktails were a little bizarre, but I love the creativity. Will definitely be back.

Try the cochon de lait po boy and the boudin balls! They're both excellent! We loved the onion rings and the buffalo wings have a unique and flavorful sauce that my husband has been back for a few times since he's been working in Nola. Great staff! - Especially Evan who helped us out with nearby brunch recommendations too! This felt like a locals-only hangout right around the corner from Bourbon Street. It's not "fine dining," but for bar food and great company, it's stellar!

I would give this restaurant a 10!!! My sister and I went to coyote crossing for lunch! All I have to say is WOW!!! There food is out of this world!!!! Everything was delish and the fresh squeezed lemonade was sooo good!!!
The food is outstanding !!! Only thing I regret is not visiting sooner !!! Flavor in each dish is amazing !

We were warmly greeted and seated promptly, orders placed, and our food and drinks arrived quickly. The plates were gorgeous and the sauces are spectacular. Our daughter ordered the sautéed (yawn) tofu salad and to my astonishment it tasted fabulous, spicy and perfectly marinated and pan- browned. The drinks were good, too, my margarita was served with a dollop of sciracha, yum.
A little off the beaten path down in queen village, but what a gem. Awesome indoor decor with a great bar that looks splendid to sit at on a cold night. Cocktails, apps, and entrees were all great.

We were looking for somewhere to eat on New Year's Eve and decided to try Koi because they didn't seem crowded. We were immediately greeted when we entered and sat at a table right away. There aren't many tables inside but you can dine-in. Our waitress was very nice and got our drinks quickly. We ordered two orders of spring rolls, one chicken and shrimp hibachi and one chicken and steak hibachi. The spring rolls were hot, the outside was crisp and they had veggies on the inside. The dipping sauce was a sweet sauce and very tasty. The salad dressing was wonderful and the salad was very cold. I loved the fried rice - the texture was like a cloud! All of the hibachi meat was delicious and I liked that it came with a good amount of vegetables. We definitely had leftovers to take home. The bill was $44 which was great for a good hibachi meal. I expected a mall-food court type meal but this was far better than I expected! Also, since it was only us dining in - it was like private dining! It seems like they do a big carry-out business. I'm looking forward to eating here again and even trying their sushi!

First time trying this place and yum!! We've been looking for a good local pizza spot in South Tampa for a few years and can't believe we didn't try this place sooner. We ordered our pizza and received it 25 minutes later piping hot. 10/10 delicious pizza.

My favorites at Mr Wok: Egg Drop Soup, Hunan Beef and Pepper Steak. I try to get a new dish every time we order since their menu is pretty big and really enjoy it all. The only thing I wasn't a big fan of? Mongolian Beef. It's very different from any other I had, most notably - it's missing green onions. Still tasty though! The absolute best thing about Mr Wok is how efficient they are with phone orders. They are friendly and super patient; no rushing you off the phone! If you order something and it's not available, they will even suggest similar dishes. Takes the anxiety out of ordering lmao. We have decent appetites and 2 small dishes plus a soup is good enough for dinner plus lunch the next day for both of us. Great deal!
Best Service, Best Food, Best Experience. 5 Stars!! You can tell from the moment you walk into the establishment you will be well taken care of.
Great dim sum place not located in Philly Chinatown. The food was good and the portion size was huge! Definitely come here with friends and family. The beef stuffed scallion pancake is a must get.
The best burgers and salads ( my fave is the Thai peanut with chicken) and the staff is always great!

We've eaten here three times in the last two months. The Pupusa, Gordita and Tamales are delicious. The Parillada platter is almost big enough for two people. The meat is flavorful , even the Mac and cheese that comes with it is yummy, portions are generous. The sauces are amazing -very different from any pher Latin style sauces.

Enjoyable new Colombian restaurant serving arepas, empanadas, Colombian fruit juices and other items. The restaurant is a little stark/ fast food "order at the counter", but the staff is friendly and the food is yummy. Recommend!

I've never had Szechuan cooking before so this was my first jump into it. I ordered the chongqing diced chicken, medium spicy. It really does numb your mouth lol this is fantastic. Very very good, I understand why this place is so popular with the locals.

Compliments to the chef. The food was delicious, and the place is beautiful. I had an out of body experience there and felt my soul leave my body and I watched myself eat a delicious steak. It was really scary but also fun. I really enjoyed this place even though I did have a little spook. 10/10 would recommend!

Everything was just delicious!! Adored the slow cooked lamb stew and the dumplings, yummmmm!!! We slated the entire meal so fast, I forgot to take pictures, haha. Excellent Baklava and Turkish Coffee was also perfection.

Cannot give this place enough stars! This is by far our favorite place to buy fresh fish in the area. Not only is the fish FRESH and amazing quality, the prices are very competitive. A couple pro moves: try the food stand in the front for a grouper sandwich and try the Blue Lagoon adult juice pouch for something fun ;) we continue to be loyal customers to this great establishment!

I grew up in Illinois and Eckert's has always been a family tradition or school field trip and it was always so much fun every time would feel like I have never been e before. The food is always so fresh and I love the peach picking tour riding the land of all the fresh vegetables and fruits they grow every year round for us. I am thankful for this Illinois Gem. They also have a really nice grocery store and restaurant connected you can do all in one. One stop shop seriously. I also love they carry local wines as well and they also let you have taste testing to try before you buy. My favorite is the Illinois Wine Cellar brand it's really delish and flavorful. If you are ever in the Belleville-Milstadt area stop by for some fresh fruit or veggies at the market. The service is always amazing as well. Enjoy until we meet again

Yes it's a supermarket, but their selections are appreciated. The aisles feel larger. Aisles look fully stocked. Produce section looks organized and neat. Florist area has interesting balloons and flower items. I like the vast alcohol section and that there were a lot of sales. **Love the deli section! Neat, clean, beautifully displayed food items and breads. We ordered a custom sub sandwich and the friendly lady came up to us quickly with "what kind of a sandwich can I make you today?" Even if I didn't come for the sandwich, I certainly would order one just from that sweet greeting. Oh, that sandwich was heavy and sturdy. Price can't be beat!

Much better service today from one of the servers that has been with Biscuits for years. They were fairly busy. Only recognized one of the guys cooking. Great Waffle. scrambled eggs and crispy bacon. And they had Jamaica. They were doing a lot of carry out too.

Very helpful, friendly staff. They genuinely seem to want to make you happy with your order. Very busy but the line moves quickly. Delicious food. Great location if you are staying at one of the hotels close up the airport.

Visiting from Redding Ca, there were so many sushi restaurants to choose from and by far the best sushi I have ever had. If you can bring the heat order the fireman roll or a more mild Dragon roll whatever you choose the servers are all nice and courteous and we'll make sure you have a great experience. 5 stars isn't deserving enough 10/10 would do it again.
Great breakfast sandwich! Ordered online and came within 15 minutes ! This here was bacon egg and cheese on a Kaiser.

Talk about a good burger place! My husband and I LOVED our burgers and the Incline Fries were the icing on the cake. My husband also enjoyed the beer on tap, while I indulged in the complementary citrus water. The customer service was phenomenal, fast turnaround time once ordered, quality food, and the pricing was comparable. We will definitely make our way back to that part of town again, specifically for this place.
One of my favorites places in the city. Food, drinks, and ambiance are all really good. I love the vegan cheesesteak burrito and have been ordering it for years!

We my husband and I went on a Saturday evening to celebrate our Anniversary and my Bday. It was our first time there. The food was amazing! Our server was Mika who did a fantastic job who went above and beyond! We will be going back for sure.
Without a doubt the best po boy's in New Orleans. Extremely nice staff, the manager is extremely kind and helpful. Great servings for the price. I recommend the fried shrimp po boy.

The food is amazing! WOW just like Italy (the real deal)! Wait staff (Ruth and Shane) were excellent, very friendly and really cared about the table. It was a very busy night and everyone handled it great! We had the best night! If you love the food in Italy this is the place. The chef is from Naples, Italy. The owners seem to really care about each table. The gnocchi is amazing!

Fresh, delicious food! A lot of it sourced locally. Can't go wrong here! We ate there while my kids were in town. My eldest is a vegan. She did not go hungry. I am not a vegan, and neither did I! If you are vegetarian/vegan (yes, I understand the difference), gluten free (like I have to be), or a meat lover, everyone is invited to the table.
Always a great experience, food came real fast. Loved the garlic wings, Best lemonade of the area. Pizza so delish!!

Pad Thai is fantastic and fresh! We have been coming here for years and every dish we have ordered has been tasty. Our favorite is the drunken noodles with chicken. They recently expanded the dining area which turned out nice and isn't so tight. You can't go wrong ordering from this establishment.

Food, libations, service, ambiance, and vibe are 5-star. The Wylder is reason alone to stop in Bosie. Newbie? Ask your server for guidance. Not that you can go wrong. I like to share one of their amazing salads and follow it with a pizza, which is irresistible here.

Ordered curb side pick up. Came out exactly when it was supposed to. Burritos are a really good size and love they have vegetarian option. Guacamole was so fresh and delicious. Will definitely be back
Always a fun time or great for a date night. Need to give it the praise it deserves. So many negative people out there!
Great food and great prices. I got the taco salad off the lunch menu for $10.00. So good!! Chips and salsa were complimentary! Great eating in the east.

Some of my girlfriends and I decided on this restaurant last minute, best decision ever!! The staff was so welcoming and even on a busy Friday night they were able to squeeze us in. Not only was the service fantastic, but the food was amazing! 10/10, and highly recommended for people who aren't from the area and are wanting to try something different.

It's easy to become skeptical after reading reviews, but all of it went right out the window the second I walked in! Nirvana Indian Cuisine is definitely the place to go to when craving Indian cuisine. Our server was Nilesh, and he was excellent! I had the tandoori chicken while my beautiful girlfriend had the chicken tikka masala. The tandoori chicken came out STEAMING. My jaw was wide open; I was so excited to try it! It was DELICIOUS! The chicken tikka masala was the best she's ever had! I also had a mango daquiri while she had a mango lassi. DELICIOUS AND REFRESHING! I also recommended getting the lasuni naan: thin, crispy, flavorful! WILL BE COMING BACK!

As long as you are patient enough for the wait...Mi Nidito is worth it!! The patty beef tacos are the best in town. Authentic and delicious Mexico food, that will not disappoint you. The wait can really suck, so be prepared. An early dinner or late lunch on the weekend might be your best bet. The frozen margaritas are delicious as well. You just can't go wrong with this Tucson original!

The five stars is mostly for the coffee. I got a cafe au lair, which is simple but depends on having good beans prepared well, and theirs was fantastic. They get their beans from Counterculture, which is one of the better coffee roasters around, and that shows, but I've also had coffee that wasn't as good from other places using the same beans. The service was pleasant and reasonably quick. It's also a pretty nice place to sit, with a number of tables in a space that has a sleek, modern design: light (maple?) wood, clean lines, semi-minimalist, with current local artists works on the walls. Way back in the day, when I was a brooding high school student, I was a regular at the Gryphon Cafe in Wayne, where I sipped coffee while writing character sketches in my Shinola notebook making fun of pretentious customers there X). I don't know if I've gone soft/too bougie, or the coffee's improved, or my palate has grown to better appreciate good coffee (I suspect a mix of all of those), but all I could think of visiting the new WC Gryphon location was how good the coffee is. P.S. My girlfriend got a chai latte and loved that, too.
Beautiful place, went there with my boyfriend for his 21st birthday. Staff was nice and helpful, the food was so good!!! Will say, the void drink is an interesting one.

This spot was on my list as soon as I booked my flight to New Orleans. Finally made it here with my boyfriend on our last day. We were greeted promptly and greeted by our server Jonathan. Jonathan was great and very friendly. We started with coffee. It was delish and fresh. For my meal I had the biscuits and gravy. It came with eggs, bacon, and a fried green tomato. Everything on this plate was absolutely delicious in flavor. The sausage gravy was one of the best I've ever had. Biscuit was airy and delish. This meal was made with love. My boyfriend had Bananas Foster Pain Perdu. Delicious as well. It was nice to see it was made with a baguette vs other bread. He enjoyed it a lot. I had a bite and enjoyed it as well. We also got a side of chorizo and a side of pork sausage. The chorizo as also the best we've had. A super delicious, filling and fresh breakfast!
This was my first time eating here and I live close. This place is amazing. Everything is so fresh. Nothing was greasy and unhealthy. I will definitely be back for the great breakfasts!
Everything from start to finish was a dream! Great wine selection, amazing service, & food was 10/10. The selfie situation in the bathroom was by far the best part tho
You know the BBQ is good when it tastes great without sauce! We went and a family and had chicks, pork, brisket and ribs and ALL were delicious!

This is a gem of a restaurant on a corner of what seems like a residential neighborhood. I came in a group of 6 around noon on a Saturday - it was quite busy but there were plenty of free tables. There are separate lines to order drinks and food (although you can order food in the drink line!) and they call your name over the speakerphone once it's ready. The atmosphere was great, food was so delicious, portions were HUGE for the price. The half and half sandwich only comes in the large size, so that means leftovers to enjoy later! There is plenty of free parking in their private lot, as well as along the street.
Getting ready to head back over in a bit. One of our favorite pizza spots in town and wanted give them a shout out. Love the Meridian Kessler and BLT pizzas. All the salads are great!

I came here for brunch with some of my friends. It's a small little shop but the seating area is cute (feels like greenhouse vibes)! The servers here were soo friendly and the food came really quick. I got the Avocado Toast. This is one of the best ones I've had. The addition of the crumbled bacon was not only delicious, but added a wonderful crisp twist to the usual avocado toast. The sweet potato fries were also not too greasy, which I liked. Overall, such a a pleasant experience here :)

Excellent restaurant! Highly recommend! We arrived with a party of six and found a table quickly. Ever aspect of our visit was terrific! Great friendly staff! Loaded waffle fries were the bomb! My burger was perfect! And I loved the Brussel sprouts with pecans. So good! Do your self a favor and come here with a appetite
Stopped here on our visit to at Louis. The food was good. The lady of soul cocktail... yummy. Service was great and fast.

I was so excited to finally try HC Tavern. It was the last of the St. Elmo restaurants I needed to get to, and I was happy to see some favorites (like my cocktail!) and to try some new-to-me things. My sister and I decided on a Saturday lunch and headed to meet in the bar. First of all, the cozy booths at the bar are the perfect mix of comfy and upscale. The bartender was taking care of us that day and despite doing both jobs she was super attentive our entire visit. That cocktail I mentioned- Herb Your Enthusiasm-is one that I fell in love with at 1933, and she made it perfectly! We decided to splurge and try the Lobster-cargot as an appetizer and OMG. Delicious chunks of lobster swimming in garlic and butter, how can this go wrong? Of course it can't! Since it was lunch, I opted for the shrimp and lobster chopped salad, it came out pretty and tasted even better than it looked! My sister chose the scallops and she said they were fantastic too. All in all we were both full and happy, and can't wait to return for dinner soon! Great place for any location or just a treat meal for yourself!

The best in SB!! Definitely give this place your business!! Food is authentic and service is the best. They gave my friends and I free dessert AND I saw that they pay their employees very well. Just an all around good local spot to support.

I told you we would be back!! As always service is AMAZING AND GREAT! We came for Lunch today! We both got 2 Sides of Vegetable soup. Which was beyond delicious. If you are ever under the weather and don't want to cook some soup. Come get some soup To Go and you will not be disappointed ! :) We got the Chicken Enchiladas with Red Sauce, side of beans. And the Shredded Beef Tacos Dorados with a side of Beans. And then we ordered the addicting side of House Potatoes ! EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS! Julio is an amazing server and does an excellent job taking care of us! Thank you so much for such amazing food. Be back again soon :)
Great cocktails and oysters. Went during happy hour so can't speak about the other food but loved that you can make reservations for HH.

We had take out breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed our meals. We tried an omelette, the chipped beef dish, breakfast tacos and french toast. Everything was delish and top quality. Also the portions were large and provided me with multiple meals. Look forward to dining in soon.

I had a delicious sesame bagel with cream cheese an drink apple juice. Perfect combo of flavors. The people behind the counter welcomed me as soon as I entered and immediately. Love how unique the bagel are in size compared to other bagel places too!
One of my favorite burgers in town! Always such a great dining experience. Everything on the menu always has you "ooooing and ahhing".

My husband and I had the best NYE brunch here. With seating outside, it was a great atmosphere and great meal. There is plenty of seating indoors as well, with beautiful decor. The bathroom is eclectic and decorated nicely too. I had the lobster and chorizo omelet, which was so amazing and flavorful. My husband had a chicken sandwich and the best potato chips. There was plenty of parking around and a lot to do within walking distance. The staff was friendly and food came out in a very timely manner. Highly recommend trying this place out if in the area!

I personally don't like hot dogs (never really have tbh) but the ones at Steve's Hot Dogs are probably some of the best hot dogs that I have ever tasted. Everyone kept telling me to give this place a try and I can totally see why. I ordered the Bacon Bacon Jamaican which is topped with sliced crisp bacon, pepper jack cheese, jerk seasoning, bell peppers and sweet chipotle sauce. Ya'll... it was so good! My friend ordered their Macho Nacho hot dog which is topped with chili cheese sauce, tomato, sour cream, jalapeños, and crushed Doritos. He also really enjoyed his choice as well. Steve's Hot Dogs is so good that I went two days in a row. lol If you haven't been there yet, definitely stop by whenever you get the chance.
Fantastic! First time there. Host and chef were great. Food was phenomenal! Wine pairings were spot on. Will be back time and again! Tonight made life long customers out of us!

Excellent experience. Ambiance, service and food. Chicken Angelo was amazing texture and flavor. Husband had Chicken Romano and was also very happy. Service was perfect. Tables were spaced nicely. Very cozy and elegant feeling with nice fire and decorations. I had been in past when it was busy and loud and crowded and slow. Food was still great and previous history of enjoying it there so gave them 4 stars. This Thursday night was perfect all around so feel I need to update the previous review. We will go here when we want a special evening out.

This family owned Italian Restaurant is amazing!! The entire family works together in unison to create an amazing and memorable experience. The food is divine and the service is 5 Star. A big thank you to the entire family. (Don't be deceived by the curb appeal. When you walk in you are transported to Italy.)

There were 3 of us for NYE dinner. My friends mom tradition is to have Chinese food for NYE. She happens to live nearby and wanted to go here again. This was my first time here. We were greeted by the friendliest staff. They took my friends mom's walker and stored it while we ate. The owner pushed in her chair so she could sit closer. He came to check on us a couple of times. He also has a great sense of humour. When we scanned out QR codes he offered us some "free alcohol" (hand sanitizer). I liked his take on that. The place is clean, set up nicely, lots of places to sit away from others and was fun. There was different Chinese art and artifacts throughout but done nicely. Our server was sweet and friendly. We were very well taken care of. We shared szechwan beef (yum), pork chop suey, beef and broccoli and plain rice. Everything was nice and hot. Food is served on heated trays and your plate comes hot too!! At the end our server spun our wet towels (to clean sticky fingers) on her finger and tossed it onto our fingers! She said she was new to it and did a great job! There's a good amount of parking here. The sidewalks are well maintained that anyone with a cane or walker can easily access this place.
Great atmosphere, and the service was excellent! As soon as I sat down, the waitress was quick to attend to me. The food was equally as good. I'm definitely going back a second time.

A truly vegetarian delight! I took a Jewish friend here and I wanted to be respectable to his food needs. Since I don't know which places serve kosher meat, I typically stick with vegetarian food which I know he loves. Every single dish had a lot of good flavor. Any of these dishes could easily have been plain and so-so or not great, but Noodle 88 knows how to prepare these foods for a grand cuisine. "88" are lucky numbers and is traditional in Asian cultures for good luck. I've been to this restaurant many times and I feel lucky to continue to receive such delicious food!
Best pizza in St Louis! Love it!! Go in to either Kirkwood or Webster And you get consistent great food!! Highly recommend!!!

5 star experience! One of the best Indian restaurants I've ever been to. Garlic naan is one of a kind, you should definitely try it. All entrees were delicious as well. New favorite place in the books.

This restaurant not only has delicious food, the staff is amazing. Sara is the best waitress and Joe, the manager literally treats people as if they are family. Stranded with bad weather and no rides available, Joe drove us to our hotel. We will be sharing this act of kindness with our entire airline. Try this restaurant! You won't be disappointed. Delicious!

I was craving some donuts and searched Yelp for a place near me that wasn't your typical chain place. Found Hole in One abs in reading the reviews I knew I had to come! They were right about getting there early. I arrived around 9:30am abs had about 5 people in front of me. The line moves pretty fast and they have one inside if you choose to wear a mask and one at their outside window. Parking lot was full also. However there is another area next door should there be no parking in the direct lot. Several menus posted on the walls and windows so you can look abs know what to want when it's yours turn. Prices pretty reasonable-- $13 for a dozen and that included 3 eclairs! Couldn't wait to get home to indulge!! My first pick was the cake donut. Wow soo good!! It's airy and moist. My fav! I've eaten the jelly filled and the glazed croissant and also tasted my hubs eclair. Eclair was really good. The filling isn't overly sweet and they donut was so soft and plain delicious. I didn't care for the glazed croissant but did really like the jelly filled. My daughter loved her chocolate frosted. Highly recommend coming here. This was my first time and I'll definitely be back!! Next I want to try their breakfast sandwiches.

I was really craving seafood but with a Vegan partner sometimes seafood restaurants don't have options for the both of us. That's when I ran into Ceviche on our walk. Bam! This was a perfect surprise. There are plentiful options and the tapas are actually larger servings than traditional tapas I am used to. The ribs slid right off the bone and the mussels were made to perfection. I couldn't stop eating the Brussels sprouts either. I highly recommend this for any dining occasion. FYI: the mussels alone could've been a full meal
White & dark chicken excellent. Slaw nice. Mac & cheese gummy. Don't order soda - their mix was off & not worth it. But chicken - chicken is off the charts. Spicy enough without overwhelming spicy

Simply the best. Do not be afraid to order dishes you've never tried before. This place is legit! Excellent value. Pro tip: (reminder) no liquor license but if you buy beer or sake or whatever at the market next door & show receipt you can enjoy an adult beverage with your meal.
Had a juicy burger with kimchi. The fries were thick cut and delicious, and they offered good portions for happy hour! Pork buns were good too. Excited about this local spot!
Great place tucked away in Somersett. They had live music when we went there. There was plenty of seating and the staff was friendly. Portions are generous. I'd go back.

One of my fondest memories of living in Edmonton in the 80's. I used to try to save money by booking off work and cooking at home, it would take me at least an hour and 15 minutes to do that. Then I found out that I could go to Double Greeting, order an amazing dish for $4.00 and be in and out of there in 20 minutes! Time is money in my profession so DG helped me to save money. And the food! So tasty, I always ordered Beef Brisket on rice, sometimes Shanghai noodles, Singapore Noodles, Amoy Noodles or Rice Rolls with onion or chicken, Steamed Chicken and Soya Chicken on Rice, I remember the first time I saw a server walking by with that plate I could not believe how good it looked coming from a small town on the northern coast, I had no idea how good food could be. Also the Gai Lan with oyster sauce was always perfectly cooked. And when I had the chili oil it cured the problem I had with cold fingers and toes in the Edmonton winters! I went there after it first opened and am so happy it is still just like I remember it.

We went for lunch on a Monday, and they had some great specials! We chose the ramen/sushi combo that got you a HUGE bowl of ramen or udon with your choice of 3 different sushi rolls. Everything was super fresh and quick to come out. We were able to take home our leftovers for lunch the next day. A must try when you're in Chinatown!

Excellent truffle/mushroom/onion cheesesteak, A1 cheesesteak and truffle/Parmesan fries. Steak rolls were mighty fine. Easy ordering, fast service and plenty of tables at lunch! Old City, so fun to walk and see buildings. Parking lot nearby, too.

I love this place! It is essentially going to St. Elmo with the same steaks and famous shrimp cocktail. I head here with the standard bearer is all booked up and frankly enjoy the slightly more relaxed atmosphere here to St. Elmo. They also have great Lundy specials!

Went there on Saturday night, about5, and sat outside. My only complaint is that the TV's were too loud. Our waitress was very good but overworked, had to feel sorry for her as she worked so hard. Cocktails were good, but are cheaper during happy hour on week nights.We ordered deviled eggs, calamari, meatballs for appetizers and found them really good. For dinner we ordered shrimp and fries, duck wings and salad, fish and chips. There were over 10 fried shrimp and 4 large pieces of fish. We definitely had leftovers. The food was hot and very good. The couple sitting near us made their meals of just appetizers and they had left overs too. If I lived closer I would return.

Every single thing we ate was amazing! And the staff was great. We forgot to take a picture of the main course, but the dessert was just as good. Also BEST lobster bisque we've ever had. Highly recommend!

A Chinatown gem -- I will be overjoyed if we ever get a similar location in NY. Everything here is spectacular from the fried dough to the salty tofu to the sesame balls. Affordable and extremely traditional/authentic, highly recommend as a breakfast option any day of the week.

This review is for food, service, and ambiance because I didn't drink so I can't speak to the beer. It was a great place for lunch though, loved the Sonoran Tacos and our server was great. The location is a bit industrial but we still enjoyed sitting on the patio and looking at the mountains. I'd recommend and return!
Incredible food, great experience, environment is very special, everyone there is French. I highly recommend this place, it will be a special experience for you and the people you go with.

I got the Steak Shawarma bowl and it was super flavorful. I was surprised with how fresh and clean the salad was as many places do not care about the quality of their salads before serving. The Lebanese Tea had the perfect amount of sweetness and as it was my first time trying this drink, it got me hooked and addicted. The staff was super friendly, patient, and quick on preparing food.
